Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Tom L
Reviews.Content: We've been to Chicago via train twice in the past year to spend a few days relaxing. I was able to get an excellent rate at the Renaissance the first time, and the location and experience from last year made us want to stay there again. While several hotels are either on the northern side for easy access to the Magnificent Mile, or on the southern side of downtown to provide convenient access to the museums and Millennium Park, this hotel resides right in between both. As a result, getting to MM is as easy as walking across the river and heading two blocks east. Walking to Millennium Park is as easy as two blocks east and two blocks south. All this being said, we are a couple who greatly enjoys walking. If you are not, taxis are never more than $10, usually about $7 or $7.50 depending on where you're heading, and you also have easy access to the water taxis when the season is appropriate. The rooms are as good as any renaissance, but the one detail that I actually found to be nice, though minor, was the fact that windows for the rooms facing the streets were bumped out, allowing you to enjoy watching the activity down the street on both ends. We stayed in a room on the east side where I sat every morning (waiting on the lovely lady to get ready, of course) to watch the activity up and down State St. The hotel is also right across the river from the two architectually famous Marina City buildings. It was always a pleasure to walk out the front entrance and marvel at their beauty.

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Laurancn
Reviews.Content: Rooms and bathroom are spacious. A little sitting area near the windows with large flat screen TV. The bathroom was very large with separate tub and walk in shower. Nicely tiled. The rooms were quiet. You couldn't hear anyone walking in the hallway. Had use of the concierge/club level which had full breakfast every morning. Great to stop and collect water and soda for the day. Had trouble access the "free" wi-fi in the club level. One morning had the buffet breakfast in the 2nd floor restaurant. Very wide selection of hot and cold food to choose from. It overlooked the Chicago river and was in a convenient location for walking to the office 10 blocks away or going across the river to Smith & Wollensky's for dinner. Everyone was very friendly & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: cuffy.fla
Reviews.Content: The best asset of this hotel is the location. Within blocks of everything we wanted to do over a long weekend – Theatre, Shopping, Dining. Fantastic view facing the Chicago River. Rooms are normal size, plenty of room for a weekend stay. Bedding is comfortable and bathroom was fine. No problems to report would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU HAVE SENSITIVITY TO SCENTED FABRIC SOFTENERS”
Reviews.Author: HowFtLaud
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at plenty of Renaissance hotels but this one washes its sheets and towels in a scented fabric softener, to which I am allergic. I tried when I checked in to get a new set of bedding and towels to no avail. This morning I was able to get them to send up new, from the box, towels that had never been washed. I had a restless night sleep itching from the sheets and pillow cases. When I asked why they wash with scented fabric softener, a no no for hotels, I was told Chicago's water was hard and the towels would be uncomfortable. I stayed at the Waldorf/Elysian and Trump in Chicago in the past few weeks and they do not wash with fabric softeners. As a Platinum Marriott/Ritz Carlton member this was poorly handled. Never was aked as I checked out how my stay was or if the problem was rectified. SO many better places to stay in Chicago than this place-especially if sensistive to scents.

Reviews.Title: “Great and convenient stay for the weekend!”
Reviews.Author: maarcsays
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance for 3 nights, after not being able to get a confirmed 2 Queen Bedroom at the Marriott Magnificent Mile. After not being able to get a 2 Queen room at the other property, the check-in clerk said that they had availability at the Renaissance property, just 1 mile away at the rate of $135/night, and said we can just do a walk-up check-in. Upon arrival at the Renaissance, the check-in line was quite long, and there was no real distinguished line for Marriott Elite Members. When we told the clerk we wanted to do a walk-up reservation, she said the rate was $165. I then told her the whole story, and even pulled out my Marriott iPhone App, to show her the special elite rate. After going in the back for about 8 minutes, she finally said she can honor it, as if she was doing us a favor? The rooms are typical of what you would expect from a Renaissance property, although its slightly showing its wear. Beds are very comfy, and the water pressure in the shower is very powerful! What's also great is that the hotel offers complimentary bike rentals during their summer months! What makes this hotel a selling point is it's location, and how quiet it is. The property is located next to all the major subway lines, and a lot of restaurants, small shops, Walgreens, 7-11, and banks and ATMs. Overall, a great, convenient, and comfortable stay. I would most definitely stay here again if the price was right!

Reviews.Title: “Very good but not the best”
Reviews.Author: TechDbug
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights. The room was spacious. The bed was very comfortable, and the staffs are nice. The only problem is some of the rooms on the east side of the hotel (rooms numbers that end with 02-20), are too close to the train track, so it can get noisy. I stayed in room 1718 my first night and I could hear the train until 2.30 AM, so avoid the east rooms. The last two nights I stayed on the north side of the hotel (river view side), and it was much quieter, and the view was nice. The gym and pools are great and you can access them 24/7. Overall, it was a very good hotel, but it was not as nice as some of the Marriott/Renaissance hotels that I've stayed in before. You can actually get a better deal and nicer views at the Marriott-Magnificent Mile just a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: krist1ne
Reviews.Content: Great 5 day stay! Easy and quick check in/out! Best experience so far! Will definitely stay again! The only thing would be the L train--it was a little noisy and we were on the 22nd floor. If you stay here--probably ask for the front room facing towards the river to avoid the noise. Buy will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the city!”
Reviews.Author: cindyzee
Reviews.Content: This property is close to everything Chicago has to offer! Walk across the street in front of the hotel and you are at the Chicago River with a fabulous view. Walk across the street in the back of the hotel and you are at the Chicago Theater and multiple subway stops. The beginning of the "pedway" starts just to the side of the hotel on State Street. The pedway is a serious of underground walkways with shops and restaurants and they even have guided tours.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, convenient, and clean!!!”
Reviews.Author: GregAndKaty
Reviews.Content: We took our kids (ages 3 and 7) for a quick weekend trip to Chicago. The lobby is very impressive-looking. It's large and beautiful. There's a bar area toward the front of the hotel. There's also a coffee shop in the lobby area. If you go a little downstairs, there's an asian dumpling placed called Wow Bao and a few other little shops. DINING The 2nd floor has a restaurant. The front desk said it was casual and fine for small children. We went right at 5 p.m. on a Saturday night, and it was okay, but I think we would have felt rather out of place any later than that. The food was very good. My husband had the filet and I had a salmon dish. My only complaint is that our water glasses appeared to have small bits of paper floating in them, which was odd, and my glass had a chapstick imprint of someone's lip on the edge. Something I really liked about the restaurant is that it has several "wellness" choices built in -- dishes low in fat, calories, or just overall better for you than the average restaurant dish. ROOM Our room was very clean. The beds were nice and firm. The bedding all seemed to be very clean. The bathroom was clean, including the shower and the shower head (a lot of times there's a decent amount of mildew build-up when you look there). Another commonly dirty spot -- the hairdryer. The one in this bathroom was clean, which was a pleasant surprise. I think it's an easy thing to overlook and therefore never clean. ROOM SERVICE Because my 3-year-old was getting antsy in the restaurant, we left without getting dessert. We ordered room service a little later. We had a spiced chocolate cake, and the kids each had ice cream. It came quickly and with four (clean) iced water glasses. There is a $3 delivery charge and a 20% service charge on top of the food price, and then you have to tip on top of that, just FYI. It was a little pricey for simple desserts, BUT worth every penny for avoiding a big scene with our 3-year-old in the restaurant. Oh, and the room service menu has a wider variety of "casual" choices on it. You can get a burger, a chicken or shrimp caesar salad, a French dip sub, etc... and these are not choices when you are dining in. POOL The pool was very nice and had a greeter of some sort. The pool is adjacent to their spa area. If it's a crowded week/weekend, I would recommend bringing your own towels down. The pool usually has them there, but a large group of people depleted the supply before we got down there. There's also a hot tub and a steam room. The pool was nice, but it was very crowded. BREAKFAST The breakfast was delicious. There were a lot more children around and people were overall dressed very casually (people in sweatpants and t-shirts in some cases). They had an omelet/pancake station. They had an assortment of cereals and a wide array of fresh fruit. The hot dishes available were eggs, egg whites, French toast, pancakes, potatoes (with thyme?), bacon, and sausage. You could also order off of the menu, but the buffet had almost everything you could want. LOCATION This hotel was very convenient to everything we wanted to see. It's in a very nice part of downtown and it felt very safe. We loved this hotel and hope to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: dubelaw
Reviews.Content: I had opportunity to stay at this property from February 9 -February 11, 2012. I arrived downtown just before noon and called as I was on my way to see if I could check in before my 1230 meeting. The operator and then desk clerk was very helpful in getting me in my room early. The food at the reception on Friday night I attend was fabulous, everyone was very nice and the complementary shoe polishing service was impeccable and definitely recommended. The only down fall like most Marriott properties is they charge for Internet access. That said there is a Starbucks connected to hotel which does not and I always enjoy Starbucks on breaks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Paladin49
Reviews.Content: Here on business for a week in January.. hotel has excellent service and typical rooms for this class of hotel.. only gripe I had was the internet service was a bit slow and restricted to one device at a time .. cost was $14.95 a day despite the $200+ per nite room charge.. Close to lots of shopping and excellent restaurants.. not a great January destination, but very nice in the summer...

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: kimhef
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel every time we are in Chicago. I am a Marriott Platinum so we typically use my points whenever we stay here, therefore I am not real sure of the rates. The views over the river and Wacker Avenue are gorgeous and gives you a real urban experience. The lobby bar is beautifully decorated and the little bites are a perfect snack before heading out to enjoy your amazing Chicago dining experience. Excellent location, especially if you are interested in the Architectural Cruise as it docks right across the street. The front desk has always been extremely welcoming and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great views and superb room”
Reviews.Author: luv2organize
Reviews.Content: I was managing 4 bands at the House of Blues and needed a nice hotel nearby. It was a perfect choice! The suite was spacious, bed comfortable, check in effortless and we had the pool to ourselves for a quick dip. The pool area was spotlessly clean. All the staff we encountered in the hotel area were very friendly and helpful. The river view was lovely. The only downside was the restaurant where my daughter and I had lunch. We asked to be seated next to the windows with a view and there were many tables available. She gave us the table with an obstructed view - a wooden design was in front of the windows - (odd since it didn't really serve a purpose). When two more people came in after us, they were seated at a full view window. When I questioned the young lady who seated us, she said, "They had reservations." So during the entire meal there were 7 other tables next to the window with views and they all remained EMPTY. This was bad customer service because I would not recommend this restaurant to others. I do a lot of networking with other music personnel and I also work at Merrill Lynch. We were there an hour and 20 minutes and the place was quite empty. She should have seated us where we requested, by the windows with a view - there were several available. After spending over $300 for a suite, a nice attitude in the restaurant would have made this hotel experience first-rate.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale hotel in the city....”
Reviews.Author: K S
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Renaissance on Wacker is a great hotel. The staff is very friendly and efficient. The rooms are slightly small but that is to be expected in a big city downtown location. The rooms are very clean, nicely appointed, the bathroom was large, and the bed was comfortable. The view we had of the river was very nice. The rates were average for the area. It is close to great dining and shopping. The valet parking is very expensive at $50 a night but in downtown Chicago that is standard. If you are looking for a clean, reasonably priced room near the loop, give the Renaissance a try.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic View”
Reviews.Author: Bzuefishx
Reviews.Content: Does a city view get any better than this? Across the river from Marina City with the Dearborn and Slate St. bridges on either side - simply fantastic. And pleasantly busy, with just enough city noise to remind you that you are in one of the world's great cities. Rooms were as expected - clean, tidy, in good condition. Have to say I was disappointed in the front desk service - took three visits over three days to correct what should have been an easy billing issue. Did not eat or drink in the hotel's restaurants or bars, but imagine they are good. In town for business for a large convention at The Mart. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, Great service! Better View!”
Reviews.Author: fltstandards
Reviews.Content: We recently had the pleasure of staying at this hotel. The front desk staff, especially Rachel was very helpful from where to go and eat to what to see. Our room was even better! It was clean, the gym was nice and we had an incredible view of the Chicago River and skyline. The hotel is just a ten minute walk to Michigan Avenue and the old Marshall Fields and "L" Station are a short walk away if you want to take the train to O'Hare. Thanks Renaissance for a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, great value & superior staff”
Reviews.Author: SoCalBijou
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights, Dec 14-19th 2011. The room was on the 16th floor, it wa quiet, beds were great, down duvet & pillows. The room was very clean. The bathrrom was your standard bathroom but with a stong & hot shower, great after walking around in the cold ngiht air. Our package included breakfast buffet daily which was reallly good. All the fresh fruit you could ever want, eggs, with omlet station, bacon, sausage, smoked salmon, french toast, pancakes, great granola. It came with a pot of good coffee and fresh squeezed juice. There was free WIfi in the hotel lobby, The bar had some great coctails and a welcoming vibe. What was really special was the front desk staff. There went out of their way to be helpful on my first visit to this great city. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: GuyfromOhio
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and comfortable hotel . . . good-looking bar and lounge . . . excellent reception staff and valet service . . . very nice Marriott Club on 26th floor with great breakfasts . . . concierge / navigator service was friendly but could use a boost.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Old Style”
Reviews.Author: alexonboard
Reviews.Content: Very easy to walk to many main attractions within Chicago, close to shopping and nightlife. The hotel itself was older and the rooms ok.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place, with some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: 1dannymac
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on News Years Eve. The hotel was crowded, with few open rooms. Upon checkin, we found food on the floor in our room (could not be moved, as hotel was full). We also were on the south side of the hotel, and could hear the L train go by every so often (despite being on the 26th floor). Overall, it was a nice hotel in a fine location, but could use improvement in housekeeping and sound proofing. For the price of the hotel, I was hoping for something nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Wicked location on Wacker...”
Reviews.Author: Totallynorton
Reviews.Content: Best location in the city. A Bazillion restaurants within walking distance. Novo lounge in the lobby is killer and Kit is by far, the best, most outspoken, female bar-tender in the "312". Food downstairs is good. No free internet in the rooms even for Marriott elite members which is just plain lame in this day of age. We locked in a room rate of $130 for the night on NYE which was awesome, but parkers beware.....$52 a night for valet service. Beautiful property, centrally located, rooms are fan-"f"-ing tastic. I would do over and over and over......

Reviews.Title: “Great location, inconsistent housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Karlos123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3x over the past three months. I travel a lot and my wife joins me when she can. Great location for shopping at Michigan Ave and State St. Short walk to Mellinium Park and right next door to the theaters. I love the location of this hotel. The food at the bar downstairs is excellent. Housekeeping and their supervisors can use some improvement. I had one really bad experience during one of my stays - the bed was made but the refrigerator had left over pizza, cereal on the floor, and to top it all an expensive Nikon SLR camera beside the television. How can these be missed? I called for the manager who moved us to a different room. Manager was apologetic and gave me 2000 Marriott points. The damage was already done. My wife and I didn't feel comfortable during that stay. I really liked this hotel but will now consider other hotels in the area. I'm still not over that experience that's why I'm writing this review.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: rams19881993
Reviews.Content: Travel much on business. Take the family here every year for a 3-4 day vacation to Chicago with friends. Location is excellent (nice area, close to shops and restaurants). Rooms are nice with good views of city, hotel is clean, service is good and atmosphere of hotel is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Large room for good price”
Reviews.Author: OakParker98
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Friday night before seeing a Saturday matinee at the Chicago Theatre which is literally kitty-corner from the hotel. Our room, 2504, was extra spacious and had a suite-like feel: king bed, sofa, desk, two floor-to-ceiling windows with partial views of the Lake, as well as a large bathroom with Aveda amenities. Swift elevators with short wait times. Very large lobby with plenty of seating areas. $129 rate which was excellent for a holiday season Friday.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pricey”
Reviews.Author: heatheranne22
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great location. Room was pretty small but very nicely appointed. Disappointed in "Chicago River View". When I booked the room it looked as if all rooms had a view. I had a slight view when standing up and looking to the extreme left. Overall a nice hotel with very nice personnel. I would stay there again and hope for a better rate (there was a medical conference in town the week that I stayed and apparently all hotels were filled to capacity).

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in the heart of Downtown”
Reviews.Author: DeeinJapan
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice view. Was able to walk to restaurants and shopping. Staff was very helpful. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hannah99Usa
Reviews.Content: The room was lovely - substantial, but not fussy. The desk people were very helpful. The wi-fi in the lobby was very comfortable and very popular. The only strange downside was the over powering smell of cooked meat in the lobby. It must have been from their restaurant, but it was not pleasant. I think they need to vent or close the doors.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: FearGlic
Reviews.Content: My favourite hotel in Chicago - ideal location , spacious room and bathroom, comfortable bed. Fortunate to have had a river view which was a treat. Good breakfast choice in the members lounge. Bar was lively with athmosphere . Great fish restaurant - Catch - right next door. Would like to see Ipod player /charger in the room which a lot of good hotels provide - CD player doesn't do much - who carries CDs around with them ? Can't afford to stay there on every trip but worth it when i do - be sure to get that river view.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel just not a hotel for kids and family”
Reviews.Author: Bill M
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at the Renaissance hotel over Thanksgiving holiday with my family. I was able to use my points and book two rooms as a platinum Marriott member. I called the hotel and requested adjoining rooms. My request was not granted even though I checked in shortly after 1pm. After complaining they were able to get us on the same floor and upgraded one of the rooms to a river view. Good to see that my platinum status gets me something. Needless to say, my wife and I are still very upset that they were not able to accommodate our request at 1pm when many of the hotel rooms are still turning over and we requested it weeks ago. The hotel staff that checked us in was not very helpful and felt that the young kids behind the desk did not understand our concern for not having adjoining rooms. Also, as a hotel that is located in the Theater district I learned that printing out tickets is quite a challenge when the concierge lounge is closed. There is a PrintMe service however its not compatible with iPad. So much for moving to the 21 century.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL IN EXCELLENT AREA OF CHICAGO!”
Reviews.Author: joeyexclamationpoint
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in Chicago! First off, if you have some extra money to spend, by all means, book a room with a view of the Chicago River! This will be among the highlights of your Chicago trip. From these rooms, you get an outstanding view of the river, Wacker Dr., the Wrigley Building, and (depending your location), the Tribune Tower, among a number of other skyscrapers. It's so nice to be in your room in the morning, have breakfast, and watch the boats go by in the river, and sometimes get a chance to see the draw bridges go up. Keep in mind, it's a big hotel, and most of the rooms face commericial streets, so you have to specifically request river view rooms when booking. Apart from the views, the hotel is clean, and the rooms I've gotten are sizable and well appointed. It's also located in an excellent area of The Loop. You're near Chicago's theatre district, so the famed Chicago Theatre is only about a block away, The Goodman and the Oriental theatres are around the corner, and the Bank of America Theatre and Cadillac Palace are just a few blocks away. You can basically walk anywhere in The Loop from this hotel-- Michigan Avenue and Magnificent Mile are just a couple of blocks away, and there's an "L" station (State/Lake) right around the corner. There is also a somewhat upscale-looking little mall attached to the back end of the hotel, and in it is a Wow Bao which I find most helpful if I'm pressed for time and want a fast dinner. Inside the hotel, there is a Starbucks, which also doubles are the gift shop, as well as a very good restaurant. I stay at this hotel whenever I am in Chicago, and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: WOF8
Reviews.Content: This was my second time here. The past time I was upgraded to a suite on the front of the building overlooking the river. It was fabulous. This time I got a regular room facing another building (I am a platinum member). The first night my door wouldn't work. After sending me up and down with 3 different keys they send a security guard. 2 hours later they opened the door and moved me. Upgraded me to a suite but it was on the corner of the building where the T runs, every 15 minutes from 5:00 am to midnight. It was so loud. The lounge was very nice. Had lots of choices. Lots of restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: yyz4
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the hotel. The room was nice and large for a downtown location. Easy, short walk from blue line train, took the train in from Ohare. Get off at Clarke/Lake stop. And walk two blocks. I loved the location because of ease to get from train. Can't beat $2.50 ride! Apprx 40 min. I had requested a couple of things foam pillows, high floor, I had to request the high floor again at check in They asked me if i wanted to pay $30 per night more for River view. If you stay on the street side request higher floor or you will hear the very loud train ! The pillows were not there but not a big deal, I just wondered if the communication from the request was even read. Comfy beds and duvet. Nice large bathroom, love the night light under the vanity, and makeup mirror. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected gem!”
Reviews.Author: roseandrie
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. We just stayed there this past weekend and was so happy we did. Our family of 5 stayed in a North facing suite that worked out perfectly for us. Main living room, with dining area-pullout sleeper and had a cot rolled in. Bedroom area was nice size with its own television (no fighting over what to watch) everyone was happy. We went to see a play, Rock Of Ages on Sat. evening and was able to walk to theater. Many places to pick to go for a drink or a bite to eat all walking distance. The lobby is spacious and was very busy. Staff friendly and serviced us on a timley manner. Asked for cot and extra towels on reservation but they were not in room when we checked in. Called housekeeping and within 10 min they appeared. Loved the shower, powerful and great pressure on the 16th floor. This was one of the quietest hotels (have stayed at many) I have stayed at. Did not hear other guests, water, above room noises. I give it a 5 star for the price!!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: Saabi13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with our 5 month old daughter stayed here for 2 nights to enjoy the sites and sounds of Chicago. This was the perfect hotel choice for us....it offered breathtaking views of the Chicago River from our room and the location was central to all the major attractions. The rooms were clean and cozy with neutral decor to suit most everyones' taste buds. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful every step of the way. All in all we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Slipping in service”
Reviews.Author: CPTVSG
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Renaissance Chicago 6 or 7 times and my most recent stay, November 2-5 was dissapointing. Service was consistently off-key. Some examples: I requested a additional bath towel which was delivered while I was out but housekeeping took out all hand towels without replacing them--a call was necessary to get a hand towel; room service breakfast arrived without any eating utensils--it took 2 calls to get utensils delivered--the food had cooled by the time room service did what it should have done in the first place; and, I had a restaurant charge on my bills which I never incurred--although the front desk did remove it without question. The bar off the lobby has food preparation on site and, frankly, it stinks. It smells like a vat of burger grease. I had one drink there and fled. The smell (stink) also permeates the lobby. Just a bad idea. I asked for a quiet room, which I received as far it was quiet within the hotel. But, it was located right above an EL stop which starts running at 5 am or some ungodly hour and was very noisy. No consideration was really given to a request for a quiet room. That said, the location is still outstanding, which is the major draw for me. But, the rooms are starting to look a little tired, too. Given all the options in Chicago, the Renaissance is dropping off my list.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but missing some of extras from previous years”
Reviews.Author: PatWisconsin
Reviews.Content: The location for this hotel is ideal for shopping and eating. Michigan avenue is about a 5 minute walk and the old Marshall Fields (now Macy's) is about 5 minutes away as well. There are excellent restaurants in the area. Several theatres are also within walking distance. The hotel lobby is really beautiful. THe rooms are small but tastefully furnished. If you are staying for any length of time, beware--there are only two drawers to store your clothing items. I have stayed here for at least the last 5 years. It was disappointing that the hotel no longer delivers a daily USA Today. The amenities in the bathroom have been scaled back to just shampoo, conditioner and lotion. In past years there were more items to use. The hotel charges $14.95 per day for internet which is a high price. The Club Level offers only coffee, water, sodas, and some appetizers at night. There is a charge for the nightly bar. Also it is closed on the weekend so it makes that level and added price less inviting. The facilities for meetings are great. All of the staff is very friendly. It seems that the hotel is cutting back on some of the extras that made it special. Still I would recommend staying here if you visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a nice location”
Reviews.Author: 99p38a
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, right on the river and within a quick walk to Lake Michigan. Surprised at how large the rooms were for a little older of a city hotel. It was clean and well appointed. I will return. We didn't have much interaction with staff, but the check in was at the level it should be for this level of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One night in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: DT_10London
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent one night at The Renaissance Chicago, using Priceline. We got an amazing night for our one night stay and couldn't fault the service and our room at all. We arrived to the hotel late at night and check in was no problem. We had requested a king bed and nice view on a high floor. We were given all of this and had a great view of the river and The Trump. The room was large with a large bathroom and amazing comfy king bed. We didnâ€™t use any facilities aside from a computer in the lobby, but the hotel looked very modern and was clean. The staff were also nice and polite. We would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: hermosa29
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location on the water and a block from Michigan Avenue. Rooms are good size and pleasant as is typical for this brand. The lobby could use a remodel to be more welcoming and comfortable. I do notice a significant cut back on shampoo, lotion etc available in the room. The concierge level offerings are popular and generous. There is also a nice bar onsite.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, reasonable prices and lots around within a few blocks.”
Reviews.Author: schneiks
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work for 2 nights in October and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The check in was a breeze, the rooms were clean, the service was nice and the meetings space was well appointed. There are plenty of food choices either in the hotel or nearby, and as with Chicago, for less than a $10 can ride you can be to almost anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WinnetkaDawn
Reviews.Content: If you want to shop, go to the Chicago Theatre, museums, and dine, this hotel has a great location. It is walking distance to most things to do. The rooms are comfortable and clean. I don't like having to pay for the Internet, but that is my only complaint. I was in town on business, but live in the area. I'd come here again just for a weekend in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: kcrampton
Reviews.Content: I only stayed for one night on a quick business trip, and it's a good hotel for the location. I think $52 for overnight valet parking is utterly ridiculous, but it's Chicago. The check-in, staff, hotel bartenders, etc. were all friendly and efficient. The King room that I had wasn't overly large and it didn't have a great view of the city or anything, but there certainly wasn't anything wrong with it. It had the standard flat screen TV and the bed was very comfortable with more pillows that anyone could possibly use. Overall, it didn't stand out from other hotels for me, which isn't always a bad thing. It's what I expected for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mango_con_Leche
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for a long weekend in Chicago. The staff is helpful, the hotel is clean, the beds are comfortable, but most importantly it is in a great location on Wacker near the river, not far from the mag mile. We walked prety much everywhere, from millineum park, to our architectural boat tour, and out at night. And there is a dunkin donuts right around the corner for breakfast :)

Reviews.Title: “An Outstanding Hotel for Over 15 Years”
Reviews.Author: gene6245
Reviews.Content: We just came back from staying here, AGAIN, as we've been doing for over 15 years. The Renaissance starts with "good bones" meaning it was well designed and very well built, and it feels almost brand new, still. I just glanced over and saw some other reviews, and they say it is an A+ experience, ..... Yep!, and pricey, ..... Nope!, Not at All !!! Book a riverview room and look over at the Trump Tower while you count, no, make that savor your savings. We've stayed at competing properties because the Renaissance is sometimes sold out or we're with a function headquartered elsewhere, so we know there are many, many good properties in Chicago, but we always come back to the Renaissance, particularly when it's our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular view of the city”
Reviews.Author: shirley0415
Reviews.Content: We have a room on the 11th floor looking at the river and it is just a marvelous view. The room is large with 2 queen size beds, a nice roomy bathroom, and good selection of pillows. We had the concierge make all our dinner reservations and she was most helpful. We consider this an A+ experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - a bit pricey lately”
Reviews.Author: Lronn H
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel, but it is difficult to justify the cost they are charging when you compare to the other Marriott brands across the chicago area.

Reviews.Title: “Had issues with third party reservations but they fixed it”
Reviews.Author: Hema K
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel located next to Chicago river. I would love to give them 5 stars but for one reason - discomfort due to the way they handled reservations and stuff. My friend had booked the room through http://cheaptickets.com for a 2 queen-bed room. On arriving they gave us the room number and when we got in finding it to a one king-size bed room. On checking with them the receptionist kept saying our booking was not confirmed because we booked the room through a "third party". So I went to the lobby and explained them that we made reservations for 2 queen-size bedroom. I was annoyed that they kept repeating that the reservation was through a thrid party and that our reservation was not confirmed so they gave us one king-size bed. They suggested giving us extra pull over bed or we can pay $90 a day for a 2 queen-bedroom which has the river view.. but thats not what we signed up for. After insisting that we want a 2 queen-size bed without paying extra and that it was our first time in Chicago, the host agreed to put us in a room that has 2 queen beds with water view. So yeah going with 4 stars. There was no kind of warning given on http://cheaptickets.com confirmation printout that the reservation is not confirmed or what are the actions to be taken if booked through third party. Found it to be such a hassle having to know that your room is not confirmed just becoz its not booked directly with the hotel.. bah! Other than this hassle, everything else was great! We indeed enjoyed our room, facilities and the awesome view from the room.. lucky us =)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay in A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LolaInSeattle
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 days and was happy with my entire stay. Service was excellent but not overwhelming, room was clean and comfortable, noise control was good. The hotel is right at the Chicago River and an easy walk to most downtown attractions, especially the Theatre District. Only negatives were no free internet in rooms and breakfast choices in the hotel were not great tasting and were expensive-but we just went out to eat at one of the many places close by.

Reviews.Title: “Generally good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: kkaseb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights and it was just a generally nice hotel. Rooms were a little bigger than some of the hotels in the area. Bed was comfortable. Lobby was pretty busy and it almost seemed that they had trouble keeping up--handprints on elevators and such. Room was nice and my only complaint was that the doors slam very loudly so you can definitely hear when anyone down the hall is coming or going. Best feature is the location--really convenient to everything. Plenty of parking in the Theater District garage if you want to handle it yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice...but expensive”
Reviews.Author: AUBeachPotato
Reviews.Content: I was a little surprised to see that this hotel does not accept Marriott points for our stay. It was expensive fir what you get but overall a nice stay. I can't say that anything other than the location stuck out.

Reviews.Title: “Review of Renaissance Chicago Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LavinaUS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Renaissance Chicago Hotel to attend a family wedding. The room that we got was on the 24th floor overlooking the Chicago river which was amazing. The room was quite spacious and the bed was unbelievable comfortable. The bathroom had a sunken tub - with marble; guest service was outstanding; the hotel offers complimentary shoe shine and the hotel staff picked up a pair of shoes to shine and return the shoes back to the room within 30 minutes. The common areas such as the lobby, the restaurant, the bar is great to hang out. The pool area is large and great for kids to hang out. On our next trip to Chicago, we will definitely plan to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently great”
Reviews.Author: mvamor
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before on business. Location is excellent if you have clients downtown. For tourists, it's a very short walk to Millennium Park, the Riverwalk, and many other locations. Lobby is beautiful and spacious. Rooms are large, clean, and very good for both business travelers & tourists. The room I stayed at this time was 1227 (can't speak for all the rooms) - it had "night" lighting for the bathroom, the blow dryer was great, air / heat worked well. No view though, and the train was quite loud (I had not heard it the last time I stayed here). The room also had several magazines and brochures on touring chicago. Tip: Ask for a riverfront view - it might cost more but I think it's worth it. If you do that, I think you'll also avoid the train noise. Room service was great - just note that the appetizer portions are quite small, even by hotel standards. Staff is friendly and helpful. Spa / fitness room is available. Room rates fluctuate quite a bit - I stay when it's under $300/night, but for example, this week, room rates are $429!!

Reviews.Title: “Always a good choice.”
Reviews.Author: Lyndae
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed in this hotel on many occassions. It is always a good choice. The location makes it easy to get most anyplace downtown. Sorry to see that Marshall Field's is now a Macys. The only place that I think they need improvement is the front desk. Each time they seemed to lack any personalization in their service, unlike the other staff that you encounter.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: NinuPune
Reviews.Content: During my 1 month stay at US, I had to visit my sister's family who were coming from some other place in US, so we decided to meet in Chicago. We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. The rooms are spacious & excellent. The view from the top floors is especially good. Service staff is very polite & courteous. The hotel has open parking, but is spacious enough. Didn't tried the food, as we were out of the hotel during lunch/dinner hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chicago Option”
Reviews.Author: jerrythetraveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property a few times and each visit has brought its challenges and benefits, last time I stayed here my room would not lock. Time before that, my wife had a allergic reation to a cleaning chemical... Why, I like the property is that, THE STAFF IS SO FRIENDLY. I know it is not NY or LA and that generally Chicago is the friendliest of the big cities, they have that mid-western reputation to live up to, but they are really nice here, even for the Mid-West. They always take good care of me and my guest and that is a plus. One expample is this: I travel and my wife comes along, she will use check-in first and after work, I will come back to the hotel. Sometime (most of the time) the hotel will give my wife or guest trouble about checking in to their or my room early to place bags or freshen up while they wait on me. This hotel will call me and verify, but the thing is they will do that, they will take the extra step without making my guest or wife feel like a criminal. Beyond the staff, which is hands down the best reason for staying here is the property, the location is wonderful. You are on the river, close to the lake, adjacent to the loop and a block or two away from the "Mile", Pier, and all the transportation. You are steps from the L, Metro and other lines and some of the best shopping and restaurants are a stones throw... but don't because there is a lot of glass in this hotel. There is a bar and restaurant on property, but they are week, so leave the hotel and you are on the tunnel route so if it is cold use the underground, just steps away. You are also seconds from many theatres and the library. The hotel is situated in a unique way that allows almost every room to have a view. Don't even sweat the river view, the views over the Chicago Theatre or Daly Plaza, may even be better and the inside corner King Bed rooms facing away from the river have a double window and are twice as large. As always be friendly at check-in and you will benefit for it. The conceirge lounge is very nice, it is two story (kind-of). At night don't bother, there nibble food was kind of week and the wine and beer selection was week as well, but the breakfast items were acceptable and they lounge is very roomy. Several quick service option are on property, including asian food and a breakfast place and there is a Kinkos/Fedex onsite a real plus for me. I like this property for the intangibles, it is not as fancy as I would expect in a Renaissance in a big city, I believe it is one of the properties that use to be a stoufer like the REN in Dallas. Here is my one complaint if Marriott is reading this, you do such a good job making REN different at the your resort locations (ie the Vinoy or Hollywood) but your downtown locations are aaaaaaaa. That said, this is a nice property and I have been able to get rates here on a Thursday through Sunday for less than $150.00 a night. I never travel for biz on a Monday though Wednesday, the prices are cheaper after Wednesday and your clients are always in a better mood. So take it from me, the REN Chicago is a Great Chicago Option!

Reviews.Title: “Picture Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Jan185
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite Chicago hotel. Every time I set foot in the Renaissance, I feel as though I am back home. The panoramic view of the river never ceases to amaze me. I have been known to just stare out the window at the Chicago skyline. The rooms exhibit a casual elegance that blends contemporary and classic decor. Additionally, the hotel management staff is very friendly and accommodating. Hopefully, we will have an opportunity to return in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel certainly not work the price”
Reviews.Author: 206driver
Reviews.Content: First problem was the charge of $15.00 per day for use of the internet, even for a Marriott rewards member. Second no free breakfast, even for rewards members. Third, the hotel is showing a little wear and tear in the public areas, the bath towels were not fluffy and limp. Plus side it was clean and quiet, although a colleague who stayed on the side of the hotel bordering the elevated rail reported noise issues. Staff was friendly. If you drive, plan on being charged $52.00 to park. Walk to a number of good places to eat. Hotel borders Chicago River walk. If you have a choice, look for other options in area.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: mcbarkr
Reviews.Content: Took a weekend to Chicago with my grandaughter. This hotel is a little spendy, but is lovely and you can't beat the location. The beds and sheets are luxurious, room service is excellent thought expensive. Shampoo, conditioner, lotion and soaps are all Aveda. There is an Aveda spa onsite that was very nice. You have to go thorugh the spa to get to the pool. The pool is small, but very nice in a 4th floor enclosed space. The hottub was out of order the whole time we were there, but you could still sit in the warm water. The coolest feature at this hotel was the steam room. It was large, warm and the steam was infused with a menthol scent that was delightful. We spend a lot of time in the steam room. Hotel is right on the Chicago River. There is a subway across the river in the Marina Towers, a Johnny Rockets on the corner, a great little frozen yogurt shop close by as well as many other restaurants. The hotel is central to the EL, the Metra trains and buses. We took public transportation everywhere. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Rock and Roll 1/2 Marathon !”
Reviews.Author: cmerun
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent. Walking distance to anything you might want. Room exellent Aveda amenities.My friend had a great massage at the spa. Great place to stay for Rock and Roll ! Novo Bar was great food and drink and service. Staff at desk was excellent. Conciergue??? But the ladies at the front desk stepped up and made it all happen for us. Def. stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: DLBroyles
Reviews.Content: Staff was extremely friendly, room was clean and had a beautiful river view!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: keb1234
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week while working in the area. The rooms are a good size and up-to-date compared to other hotels I have stayed in in the area. The lobby is gorgeous, and all the staff that I encountered friendly (with the exception of one bartender). Sometimes it is hard to get your room cleaned - if you have the do not disturb sign up in the mornings and then go out in the afternoons, housekeeping may have already been in your part of the hall and will not come back and check - they will call your room and leave a message, which you will not receive if you are not in the room! Call the front desk and specifically tell them you want it cleaned. If you are a MR member, concierge lounge food is great. Nice indoor pool, ok gym, parking is expensive at $49/day. Great location - walking distance to Michigan Ave, theater district, lots of restaurants around hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for business and fun in downtown...”
Reviews.Author: gcgrayburnjr
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in the middle of the business district, but only a short walk to several wonderful restaurants and bars. Rooms are very clean and the staff is very friendly. Highly recommend the hotel concierge service...they provided A+ tour and dining options including preferred seating status in many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but the price...”
Reviews.Author: forthetweeple
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for a conference from July 24-27 2011. Nice rooms, excellent customer service. I had one problem, the conference rooms are utterly confusing. I spent time walking around not finding any of the rooms I needed. It was also a great value in terms of price, because it's right in the middle of all the great things in Chicago. Also, the internet was $21.00, and that's just ludicrous.

Reviews.Title: “Very upset by service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: miamiman40
Reviews.Content: As a platinum Marriott traveller, I was surprised by the lackluster service I received from the staff at this location. Normally, I love Marriott and their service; however, in this case I was less than impressed by the level of service I received. Normally, as a platinum member I would expect extra amenities from a hotel I spend an exorbitant amount of money with...but after a long discussion with the front desk...I will keep my standard room (which is fine)...but will pay for parking and receive no additional breakfast or any other amenities. For my money and amount of travel time I'll choose Hilton because they treat me better. The renaissance is fine if you only need a room and don't care about customer service...otherwise don't bother!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: copygirlBoston
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to a larger room, which was very contemporary and nicely decorated - with views of both the Lake and the River. Beds were comfortable and there was a separate tub and shower. Larger room comes with concierge level access - breakfast choices were very nice and I like having coffee, water, soft drinks and snacks available all day long. The location was good - in the past I always stayed on No.Michigan Ave, but this was nice, too - and it was about a 10 minute walk to the Miracle Mile. Also a short walk to the pier for the Architectural Boat tour - which was our favorite part of this trip. Housekeeping never replenished the shampoo, conditioner, etc. - but it didn't really matter since I didn't like them anyway. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located, rooms over looking Chicago River are best. Will become my hotel of choice in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: SAFARIMAN80
Reviews.Content: Great property well located. Rooms over looking Chicago River are best. Will become my hotel of choice in Chicago

Reviews.Title: “A new favorite in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: mpjc121
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in July 2011 for three days while on business for a week in IL. My partner flew in to join me for the last three days and we had a wonderful time. I had booked a King room but because I was a platimum member with Marriott I was upgraded to the to the concierge level and given a room that I can only describe as jaw dropping. It was a corner King and must have easily been two or three times the size of a regular King room. Double sinks in bathroom with separate tub and shower. The service in the hotel is really really good. Room service arrived quick and was piping hot, parking valet was quicker than I expected for a city hotel given it's size. The breakfast was great and plentiful. The staff helpful to a fault. I am usually very critical and particular about hotels because I travel so much for work and i like things a certain way and I was a little taken aback that I could not find anything to pick on. I will without doubt stay here on my next trip back to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but very expensive!”
Reviews.Author: elouise_8
Reviews.Content: Really loved the Hotel and its design. The special ordering of amenities was not good and check out was not very timely but the stay overall was fun due to friends attending the same wedding as we were. Tried to book a third night for the same rate as the first two but they could only offer $279 vs. a $189 rate. Too bad, would stay again if they offered a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok”
Reviews.Author: Jmobileguy
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent business traveler, so the things that are important are that my room is cleaned, I have easy internet access and of course a decent bar atmosphere for after a long day. Having said that, my first day it was very hot and humid in chicago, so I went back to my room to change shirts, the room had not been cleaned by 3:00 pm, ouch! Internet access was easy and no problem there. The bartenders were great, but it's a bit of an uncomfortable bar, definitely not a loungy type place where you can meet clients etc. Lastly my dealings w the front desk when I was checking, very curt and not friendly. It's a nice property but for what my expense is going to be a bit underwhelming...

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and location!!”
Reviews.Author: CLEMS0N91
Reviews.Content: What an outstanding trip. Friendly service, beautiful view, great room, close to mass transit. A fantastic place to stay when you come to Chicago! Lobby offers free computers to print boarding passes, business center and restaurant on site. What more could you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: Ctrigg1
Reviews.Content: Stay at the Renaissance frequently, had wedding party stay there when we got married. Rooms are nice and comfy. Suites are big and beautiful. Some of the nicest views of the city. Staff is always very helpful and friendly. Only negative may length of time waiting for valet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: amysimons
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easy to get to from Midway Airport via the Orange line on the Loop. Your stop is state/lake and it is on the backside of the hotel! Michigan Avenue is within walking distance as well as great restaurants. Hotel staff are friendly and very helpful with information about the city and providing maps, etc. Don't pass up the opportunity to have the breakfast buffet at the hotel.....fabulous selection and once again staff are very friendly and provide excellent service. And last but far from least.....THE BEDS ARE AMAZING, you will wake up after having the best night's sleep!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location - Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: janna39
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay here at least twice per year. The hotel is located perfectly for the theater, shopping and world class restaurants-right on the river at State and Wacker. Rooms are spacious and clean and the staff well trained and friendly. Note- Parking is not cheap. Very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: FromHareskovby
Reviews.Content: The service was professionel Nice big and clean room Great location in center of Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Overall great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: mrae0410
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for a weekend (3 nights) just as a small get away vacation. Our room was very clean and put together. We chose to upgrade to a room with a lake view and we were really glad we did! They recommended we upgrade so that we wouldn't hear the train and we would have the added bonus of the great view! We didn't hear the train at all and the view was beautiful! The shower and bathtub are nice size along with the rest of the bathroom. Our bed was very comfortable with a lot of pillows. The pool was average size but was well kept. The parking price was a little high but about average price as the rest of the hotels downtown. We had a small issue with our concierge and some scheduling but we worked around it the best we could. Overall, I would recommend this hotel and would have no problem staying again. Clean, friendly, and comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Large room, attentive service and extremely quiet”
Reviews.Author: Scoutwise
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a Chicago weekend - a parent's escape from our children. The hotel location was fabulous with easy access to the L and sights. The room was clean and larger than some of the hotels we have stayed at in the city. I usually don't sleep well in hotels, but the room was so quiet, I slept solidly. The pool and exercise areas were fantastic with a spa-like feeling. We only ate at the Novo Bar once and found their small plates were reasonably priced. The nachos were a bit bland, but they were still a nice option for a light dinner. Overall, the hotel was great and we'd definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and perfect location. Staff and service were wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: bny000
Reviews.Content: The view from our room was amazing, overlooking the river and the lake. Room service and restaurant food and service was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great concierge service.”
Reviews.Author: STLATL
Reviews.Content: On a recent weekend getaway with friends, we decided to stay at the Renaissance Chicago because we are big Marriott fans. The staff at this hotel were very friendly, especially the concierge staff who went out of their way to help us. This is a great location - convenient to Millenium Park, Chicago Art Institute and the Magnificent Mile.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Location and the best staff...”
Reviews.Author: Jennashay
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel. Not only is it in an excellent location, walking distance to just about everything as well as train/bus stops, but the staff was incredible. We had the unfortunate experience of our car breaking down as soon as we pulled into the hotel. The valet staff could not have been more accommodating and they helped calm down a very frazzled family that was ready to begin a great vacation in Chicago. Front desk staff and concierge were equally nice. Our room was spacious and clean. I would definitely recommend this hotel and can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and a great room”
Reviews.Author: moneytrain8
Reviews.Content: Travelled here with a friend who had never been to Chicago. I have been here several times at various hotels, and I think this one was my favorite. First is the location. It is RIGHT at the stops for the Orange Line (from Midway) as well as the Red Line (up to Wrigley Field... we were there for a Cubs game). So it was perfectly situated in terms of getting to the hotel from the airport. $2.25 in subway fare is SO much better than a $20-30 cab ride or a car and $49 parking! The subway is world class, especially compared to the lackluster system in my hometown of Baltimore. As well, the location here was RIGHT on the river, so while we didn't have a river view (we weren't in our room much anyway), we could walk pretty much anywhere downtown: House of Blues, Harry Caray's, John Hancock, restaurants, Navy Pier, Millenium Park, Riverwalk, etc... all within a short walk. In fact my friend complained that I was making him walk too much! We were on the same side of the "L" and on the 7th floor, so while we could hear the train go by, it was no louder than a car going by and it never woke us up or bothered us in any way. So if you are looking for something that will save you cab fare, this is the place. The room was as nice as any other place I've stayed in Chicago - and we don't stay in cheap places in general (Palmer House Hilton was our last one, and I think we stayed at another Hilton previously). The place was sold out, so we were stuck with a room with a king bed and pullout sofa bed instead of two queens, but that was the only hitch to the whole experience, and my friend said the sofa bed was fine. I usually don't sleep well in hotels beds but these were nice. The bathroom was clean and updated. The only problem with the bathroom for me was that there was no fan or good ventilation, so when I took a shower the room got very foggy. Should be some sort of fan or something to help de-steam the room. We had a fridge in our room; I noticed some other reviewers said there were not. The lobby was rather cold, but it was also 90-95 and humid for our trip, so we didn't mind! There is a lobby coffee shop that serves Starbucks, which is fine, but there are also about 5 Starbucks within two blocks of the hotel, including a full service one in the shops in the "basement" of the hotel, so if you want a real Starbucks or something in particular like a frappuccino or something, you can just go down to that storefront level. Overall, this was a great experience. My friend is a huge fan of Chicago now, and being able to walk to places easily and everything being close (as well as being literally feet from the subways) made that experience even better for us. I really don't know if I would stay anywhere else on subsequent visits to Chicago - this one really gave us what we wanted (proximity and ease of travel) for our trip. I'm sure you can find swankier places or places with friendlier bartenders or a nicer restaurant in the hotel, but if you're visiting Chicago to sightsee, who wants to eat at the hotel or drink in the hotel bar when you have SO MUCH within a 5 minute walk? I don't need a nice view of the river when I am spending my day out walking along the river! But that's just my take on the people who criticize the hotel bar/restaurant when they are going to a vibrant city like Chicago - put your shoes on and experience this great world city!

Reviews.Title: “Still a great Chicago hotel”
Reviews.Author: nongagkram
Reviews.Content: Recent stay for a long family weekend met all my expectations. Opted for a suite opposed to two rooms. The 600.00 up charge was about a break even but the room was great and we all stayed together. Misc comments: employees are wonderful, very helpful and professional Room service very efficient Hotel quiet 2 years age they changed the bar from an open lobby type with big chairs and couches to a traditional (dark) bar. I liked the old one better Executive floor lounge closed on weekends which means breakfast for four = 80.00++ Still my favorite in Chicago

Reviews.Title: “SO many better choices in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: MauiBear
Reviews.Content: We stayed her because it was suggested by the wedding party. While the location was fine (we had a view of the river), the hotel was only "ok". This is a BIG hotel and the lobby was kept at around 60 degrees (or so it felt) and it just wasn't that hot in Chicago. The rooms were nicely appointed but the bathroom was so poorly designed that it was impossible to get close to the mirror because the counter top was SO deep. We had to ask twice for additional blankets and towels (they provided only 2 for 2 people) and, when the room was cleaned the next day, they did not replace the extra towels so we had to ask again. I didn't find the staff to be overly friendly but the bartender was good and knowledgeable. With so many great hotels in Chicago, I wouldn't stay here again, especially with a $49 parking fee!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Travel2London
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in July 2011. When we arrived early (around 1 PM), they allowed early check-in and our room was ready for us. It was on a lower floor, so we didn't have a good view. The room itself was clean and well furnished. There was a flat screen tv (with limited channels) and coffee maker, but no fridge (when I called to ask prior to the trip I was told there was one in each room). The bed was very comfortable with nice fluffy pillows and a solid mattress. However, we could hear the people in the rooms next to us pretty clearly, which was frustrating! The bathroom had a hairdryer, shampoo, conditioner, and soap, but very few bath towels (we had to ask for more). The biggest issue we had was the lack of hot water in the bathroom. It was lukewarm at best and kept alternating to cold! The location of the hotel is excellent, but be prepared to pay a lot if you are parking ($49 a night). We were able to walk to Millenium Park, Navy Pier, the Magnficent Mile, and John Hancock building. There are plenty of restaurants surrounding it as well.There was a small cafe inside that brewed Starbucks coffee and had a variety of breakfast foods that was reasonably priced. We didn't make it to the bar, although it looked nice. Check out was easy. Overall, a good experience with a few glitches.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in the Heart of Chicago. Would return!”
Reviews.Author: BizTravlerJunky
Reviews.Content: During check in, there was an issue with the card programming system. Unfortunately, I had to return to the front desk three times before my card was programed correctly. I was upgraded rooms given my Marriott Rewards status. I was put on the top floor on the Concierge Level, very nice upgrade! Room was very spacious and had a great view of the river! Only downfall was the noise from city traffic, train and sirens from ambulances and/or fire trucks. If you can sleep through that or it doesn't bother you, then you'll be OK here. Room service was a bit pricey. Hotel is close to shops and restaurants that are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “A must-stay hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: lrmlrm97
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here and we LOVED it. Our room was on the concierge level, so the breakfast was great, and the evening snacks were delicious. The lounge even had a free business center for only the concierge level guests. Our room was huge and had a view of the Chicago River. Our bathroom was magnificent, with tiled floors, tiled shower, and marble countertops. When we couldn't get our laptop to connect to their Internet, they sent someone up who fixed it and told us the Internet was FREE for the 8 days we were there. The pool was loved by the kids, and the lobby was beautiful. The elevators were very fast and you never had to wait for one. The hotel had a back door that is 20 feet away from the L AND the red line. It was in a great location, and had great service. If you can, stay here, and you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality In the Heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: topresorts
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been beautifully renovated. Despite a hideously hot day (like 100 degrees hot) the AC worked beautifully in the rooms and public places. When we checked in, we were helped by Nick, the front desk manager. This gentleman was unbelievable in how he went above and beyond to help us. He engaged our children, proactively helped with the valet parking to give us a 30 minute grace outside so we could get settled and personally made sure a rollaway bed was delivered promptly. The hotel has great river views and is just a few steps from Michigan avenue. Rooms were very clean and the property was very well maintained. For those of you who complain about parking, realize that this is not the hotel charging this but a separate company and it is downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ufrc75
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends over a year back. This is a very nice hotel right on the river. Ask to see if you can get upgraded to a river view. If they are not packed, sometimes they will do it for free and it is worth it. The view is beautiful. The concierge level bar/continental breakfast and snacks are only open on weekdays to cater to business travelers, but was nice when it was open (as always they charge for booze at marriott concierge levels) The rooms are standard Marriott/Renaissance. Duvets, flat screens, sitting area. Bathroom is slightly larger than what I was expecting for an early 90s built hotel. The area around the hotel is nice, but you are a short walk away from the Michigan Avenue magnificant Mile shops (about 10 minute walk); however, the hotel has a lot right around there to keep you busy if you don't want to go anywhere. The staff here seem to be very well trained and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Did not like the forced upgrade room scam”
Reviews.Author: redshoe9
Reviews.Content: Sister n Law and niece come for a visit and we booked this hotel based on location and positive reviews. Upon check in the staff informs me that a room with double beds is not available (even though I booked that) and that I can either get a king bed or "upgrade" for 40 bucks a night to a room with two beds. I find this horrible. You cannot seriously think two women and two kids are going to want to sleep in one king bed. So what choice did I have but to do the upgrade. That eighty bucks will prevent me from ever staying there again. The hotel looked clean and had a good location but to allow people to book a room on their website at a certain price and then upon arrival hold them "hostage" unless they upgrade is not acceptable. For that price I could have stayed at a much nicer hotel located on Michigan avenue with better room amenities and quality. Had to beg for more towels and shampoo. Towels were thin. Shampoo and conditioners were scarce and the "ambiance" was lacking overall. Room was your typical hotel room, beds were comfy but down pillows are always saggy. Upgraded "view" was looking down on the roof of the lower restaurants. Hotel has a pool but it's so tiny. Good for kids as it's only 5 foot deep but for adults who want to swim serious laps or want a little R & R...this is not the pool for you. There is a steam room and a hot tub, both are adequate but not luxurious. The whole spa area looks like a after thought and you would never confuse it for a "spa resort" type hotel. We did not eat at the hotel since it's way overpriced. Head over to South Water Kitchen or Atwood Cafe for breakfast and lunch. The only advantage is location on State street but other than that, there are much better hotels for the money. Next time I will know better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for business or leisure”
Reviews.Author: dralexander
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week for a conference. The room I had on the 17th floor was clean and well appointed. My room was right next to the elevators and I was concerned at first but the walls are thick here and noise was only an occasional problem due to inconsiderate guests. This would have been the case down the hall as well. My one complaint is that the elevator music is LOUD in the elevator lobby and I could hear it in my room. The room itself was comfortable except the work desk. There is no office style chair so working for any length of time is difficult. Sleep quality was excellent. Also the room has windows that can be opened; a major plus in my book. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling on either business or leisure. And if you are hosting a meeting, the hotel has wonderful facilities and the best catering I have experienced at a hotel convention.

Reviews.Title: “It was great!”
Reviews.Author: tmcvicker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel 4 nights. The first 3 were on business. As a company we had over 500 people staying at the hotel . We had breakfast, lunch and dinner served. It was outstanding! The staff, service, rooms and food were top notch! The room was very clean and up to date. The staff was very helpful and always friendly. The location of the hotel is perfect. We road the "L" from Midway to the hotel and walked the rest of the time. Everything was within walking distance. We road the "L" out a little further and had no problems. We loved Chicago and the Renaissance Hotel! I can't wait to have a reason to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: FTLAW
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right across from the river and the river view rooms have an amazing view. The lobby is quite large. The guest rooms are large and bathrooms are quite well appointed. Flat screen TV, of course. Refrigerator and safe in room as well. The gym is not a bad size. The concierge lounge is not the biggest, but had tasty offerings for breakfast. The front desk staff was friendly. The location is top notch with easy access to everything downtown Chicago has to offer. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Beautiful hotel. Great service. Nice Bar.”
Reviews.Author: ajranch
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business when attending a large trade show. Within walking distance of the Merchandise Mart, Michigan Avenue, and downtown Chicago. Right across the street from the river. This hotel is definitely worth the $$$ to stay here. The bar was recently remodeled. Excellent restaurant (Catch 35) right next door. One suggestion.... Have them put you in a room where you won't here the L train. I was on the 16th floor and could still hear it. This gets a bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “World Class”
Reviews.Author: Mrmojo58
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Great service from the staff @ every level.. One of the best Concierge lounges @ any Marriott I've stayed at & I've stayed @ over a 100 a year for many years. Highly recommend, will look for every opportunity to stay there again. 5 Stars!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: ksg1119
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend over this past Memorial Day week-end. It was not my first stay at this property, but the last time I was here was about 6 yrs ago. Some things are the same, but sadly some things have changed ... Pros: Great location, easy access from both the Blue Line (O'Hare) and Orange Line (Midway), and just a short walk to Michigan Ave. Large rooms, comfy beds and bedding, large bathroom with Aveda products. All staff we encountered we friendly and helpful. Cons: They used to have complimentary coffee in the lobby, but not anymore. When the desk agent saw me looking for it, she said there should be a coffeemaker in the room, but if there wasn't she would have one sent up. The room DID have a coffeemaker, but if you hate powdered "cream" like I do, that is really not a good alternative. The room was booked for 2 people, but they only had 1 robe in the room. I suppose we could have asked for another one, but you shouldn't have to! At check in, I was asked what kind of newspaper I wanted on Monday, USA Today or Wall Street Journal. I asked for the USA Today, but got nothing ... There was no refrigerator in the room, but when I asked about one, they sent it right up and it was complimentary. So this comment could go in the "pros" also! Lastly, as I know this is primarily a business hotel and not very busy on holiday week-ends, I have always asked for and gotten a room with a river view at no additional cost. This time they charged me an additional $30 per night for the river view. This was disclosed at check in, and I had to sign off on it, so it was not a surprise on departure. But given the fact that we checked in around 10 a.m. on Friday and both room types were available, that tells me they weren't very full. I know we are all in business to make money, but good will for travel partners (I am a travel agent as well as a Marriott Rewards member) goes a long way. I have even been upgraded to the concierge floor in the past, but I guess those days are over. Bottom line, I will probably stay here again, but I'll bring my own creamer!

Reviews.Title: “Melinda from St. Louis”
Reviews.Author: Chico44881
Reviews.Content: Renaissance Hotel O'Hare: Staff was very accommodating. However, many hidden costs that if "far-warned" I would have avoided some of them. I.E. $100 add. deposit of credit card, No free parking for Visitors ($20, whether 24 mins. or 24 hrs.) and hidden fees for using the phone.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accommodating and excellent customer service!”
Reviews.Author: MrShowman
Reviews.Content: We had a group of business owners for our National Trade Association and we all enjoy the accommodation's. Every employee was very nice, they cared for our needs, the rooms were nice, the food was great and no one complained. I'm from Chicago and I helped pick the hotel; I'm glad I picked the Renaissance and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay”
Reviews.Author: aca828
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 3 times and each visit has been great. A little pricey but you have to expect that in downtown Chicago. Great location with everything Chicago has to offer within walking distance or cab ride. The L stop is steps from the State/Lake entrance. Hotel pool is well appointed and offered plenty of room for kids to play. Parking is over the top ($49/night) so look for a local garage to stash the car if necessary. Grant Park East offered the best overnight rates as of this posting.

Reviews.Title: “The Heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Bojanglez
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this hotel for location, size of the room, and comfort. We booked through Expedia so managed to get a great price. The hotel very kindly upgraded us to a suite, as it was a special weekend and my partner is a platinum Marriott member. The room was fantastic - great views of the river, Trump tower, Chicago Tribune building, plus we had a full living room and two bathrooms. The gym is one of the best I've seen in any hotels. The hot tub, steam room, and pool were also just right. Try the Asian restaurant (Yao Bao, I think?) located in the same building, just past Fedex in the basement. Excellent and cheap steamed buns!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, convenient location close to Millenium Park”
Reviews.Author: Reisewarner
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance hotel is located close to Millenium Park, Chicago Art Institute and Magic Mile, all of these are within walking distance. Got a room in one of the upper floors, spacious with a large bathroom. Bathtubes always seem to be the same in these hotels...too small, too inconvenient.....The bar in the hotel seems to be nice and well attended. The loop train might be noisy in some of the lower floor rooms but from the 20th floor not a problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location and service”
Reviews.Author: CharlieChiWeenie
Reviews.Content: For me, this is the best location in Chicago.
