You are on State Street with a view of the river and can walk within a few minutes to the theater district or Michigan Ave for some shopping. The service at this hotel is what you would expect for the price - first rate. The rooms are comfortable, nicely decorated, and most offer a good view. From our room we could see the river, the Chicago Theatre, and the Wrigley Building. This hotel is pricey, but worth it. On our stay, we were on the 15th floor and had only two problems. First, there were some guests who were a bit loud in the hallway. I called the front desk and security came to quiet them immediately (both times). The hotel can't keep guests from being a bit loud while enjoying themselves, but they did all they could to keep them quiet after receiving complaints, so I appreciated that. The second problem was that there were a lot of sirens in the city and we could hear them from our room. I've stayed in Chicago many times and have experienced the same problem at all hotels, so there isn't anything that can be done about that. Just ask for a room as high up as you can get, but even the top floor won't keep you from hearing sirens. Parking is steep, but there are plenty of self-park garages nearby, so choose one of those to save a few dollars, if you are interested.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice in the Loop”
Reviews.Author: Greataunt
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night on a business trip based on a recommendation from our corporate travel staff. The room was comfortable and well appointed. The linens were what you'd expect from a Renaissance and the bed was very comfortable. I used the fitness center and was pleased with the selection & variety of equiptment. I plan to stay there again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: luna6373
Reviews.Content: stayed here with my daughter for a weekend was lucky to get a corner suite and it was amazing big clean and well decorated the staff was very helpful and attentive to our needs and the location and the view cant be beat as well it was over looking the Chicago river and the Chicago theater the pool was very peaceful and spa like very happy with our stay and returned here again

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: mikeswt
Reviews.Content: Can't wait to come back. Great location and close to L. Will bring wife next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room quality!”
Reviews.Author: Srcargill
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this past weekend and was very pleased with my choice to stay here. My girlfriend and I were celebrating our anniversary and this hotel suited our needs perfectly. It was in easy walking distance of everything and having the river right in front of the hotel was great. The beds were very comfortable, rooms were very spacious, and the bathrooms were quite large. Our in room mini fridge wasn't working and they brought up a new one for our wine within 10 min and without even asking they brought two wine glasses for us! We had a room that was not a river view but on a corner so we had two windows and a great view of the city! Request one if its possible.

Reviews.Title: “Elevator Noise”
Reviews.Author: danielbeez
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice hotel, BUT: I stayed on the club level, my room was on the opposite side from the elevator. In other words, the elevators mechanisms were right behind the t.v. on the far wall away from the bed. All day and night, there was substantial elevator noise. Fortunately, I brought ear plugs with me and that was sufficient to drown out the elevator. But the fact that this noise exists is unacceptable and points to a design flaw in the hotel. I surely couldn' t be the first person to notice this, and they should only give these rooms to guests after warning them about the noise and offering a discount. If I had been staying more than one night, I would have asked to switch rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Attitude is everything. Front desk customer service ruined stay.”
Reviews.Author: teriw1214
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property several times, unfortunately we did not have a pleasant stay this time. The location is great! Shopping, Dining, the Art Institute, Millennium Park, Opera and Theatre all within walking distance. The rooms are comfortable, most with nice city or river views. Linens do seem to be getting a bit worn & no minibar. First impressions really do mean a lot. Upon check in, I reminded the clerk my husband is a Gold Elite member and asked if the upgrade to the Club Floor was available. She said yes but the club is closed on the weekend. I replied, â€œTypically when the club is closedâ€¦â€� She interrupted me midsentence and flatly said â€œwe do give vouchers for breakfast.â€� As she handed me our room keys I confirmed again the room upgrade. As I was entering the room I noticed dirty dishes outside of the room. We enjoyed the lovely view of dirty dishes for most of our stay since they were not removed until around 12n the following day. Typically this would not have bothered me but after the course treatment at the front desk, the tone was set for our entire stay. When the bellman brought our luggage to the room he asked if I was happy with the room. I flatly told him no. The clerk at the front desk was unaccommodating and this is not a club floor or upgraded room. He apologized and said he would notify the manager. Around a half hour later we received call from the front desk. They did offer to move us to a club floor room (really? Didnâ€™t I already confirm said room twice?) I declined since we had already unpacked and had to leave shortly for dinner and the Opera. She said they would be crediting our Marriott account 500 points for the inconvenience. Wow, thanks. Thatâ€™s a value of about 50 cents. Last summer we stayed at the Marriott on Michigan Ave. We had almost a similar experience with their front desk. In December we stayed at the Conrad Hilton and found the front desk to be more than accommodating for our entire stay. At this point we feel as though Marriott does not value their loyal customers or travel agent partners. For our upcoming trip to Florida, I cancelled our reservation at Marriott Sanibel and booked a Starwood property.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is very good but falls short of great.”
Reviews.Author: CheersTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good location (not great), service calls/questions were immediately addressed, free hot drinks in the lobby on a daily basis, nice pool, very close to the eL trains Cons: Room was not ready when we arrived (arrived right at check-in time) and we had to wait 45 minutes at the hotel's bar, room was not clean as we found dirty socks, etc. on the floor, bedding & pillows were inadequate

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable, ideal location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: dauphin_army
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and 3yr old daughter for 1 week over the Christmas Holidays. Very comfortable and great location, 2mins walk from Macey's and Sear's which are in tuen only across the street from each other, The Magnificient Mile is only 10mins walk.. Make sure you eat in the 'Kerryman' Irish Pub too.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Chicago Weekend”
Reviews.Author: brmusicman
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a holiday weekend in Chicago and really enjoyed it. The hotel's location is superb -- right in the middle of downtown, with easy access to both the "Miracle Mike" and all of the stuff on State Street. It's also within a block of the El and the below-ground subway. So, a truly easy way to access all parts of the city. The room was very nice and well-appointed. Spacious bathroom, decent working area, nice sitting chair, extremely comfortable bed! The room was quiet even though the hotel seemed busy. The decor in the room was pleasant; the bathroom wasn't my personal style (green marble basin, etc.) but was in good condition. I enjoyed the hotel's public spaces. Clean, spacious hallways; a big lobby with just the right amount of people. Everything was beautifully and tastefully decorated for the holidays. With the exception of one crabby bellman who helped us store bags on the final day, service was excellent. At check-in, we requested a room with a view of the Chicago River. Even though we were staying on Marriott Rewards points, the agent worked to make this happen and was extremely gracious about it -- definitely appreciated! The Concierge was very helpful about finding a place for us to grab something to eat after an extremely late arrival. When we ran into a glitch with our keys not working on the lock during the final morning of the stay, security was quickly dispatched to the floor and the hotel apologized for the quick service glitch -- I really appreciate a hotel that acknowledges, and then quickly fixes, a problem. Service at the entrance was always superb -- the gentlemen who hailed us cabs were all very friendly, and when one of them saw me returning to the hotel with my hands full with coffee cups, he even rotated the revolving door for me. Overall, this hotel did a great job -- would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, great staff, nice ameninties for Platinum Rewards Members”
Reviews.Author: HudsonValleyGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights for an event at McCoramick Place. The room was room, clean and what I would expect from this higher level brand. All the staff I came in contact with were friendly and professional. Housekeeping was likewise. The location was right at they loop, easy walking distance to restaurants, theaters and shopping. Sightseeing was also a good walk (Sears/Willis Tower) The 26th(?) floor lounge for card holders had a nice free buffet breakfast in thye morning, weith hot and cold selections. I took the blue line back and forth to O'Hare... the station being a block and a half from the Lake/Clark St station. It's an easy trip if you have 1 bag... and avoid rush hour.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kitkat343
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this hotel, as it was close to excellent food (mmm... we loved Gino's East) and within walking distance of Chicago's excellent shopping. The rooms were of a good size and they were very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the trip”
Reviews.Author: segs77
Reviews.Content: It's always a treat when somebody who does things right does something for you. This place is worth the trip. Granted, I was staying in a suite on the Concierge Floor, but still, it was well done. The rooms themselves are a bit dated, but the service level was fantastic. Parking is pretty steep ($49 per night - wow.) The bar/restaurant in the lobby is worth a stop as well, if for no other reason to people watch. The food is pretty good, too. Try the Kobe sliders.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: GenieWigan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and wished it could have been for longer. The room was great, very comfortable, bed was just right and felt like heaven after a long journey and not a lot of street noise for a downtown hotel. The view from our window was quite spectacular, straight over the river to Trump Tower, Wrigley Building and Chicago Tribune. 10 minutes walk to the Magnificent Mile, 15 minutes to Navy Pier. Staff were very helpful and recommended places to eat, of which there are many locally. Smith & Wollensky just across the bridge for a great steak. Did not try out the leisure facilities as we didn't have time but they looked good, bar also looked inviting but again, didn't have time to try it out unfortunately. Did the bus tour, which is great to get your bearings, I think most tourist attractions are quite walkable though (if you don't mind walking or are able to walk a while). Would definitely stay here again when in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good service.”
Reviews.Author: shafet
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, and great "fun" bar. It's located in the heart of downtown. Overall, a great property and god service.

Reviews.Title: “Executive suite was tired, a bit dirty, and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: frequent_traveler888
Reviews.Content: I've gotten to the point in life where I have the means to spend some money on higher end things from time to time, but not every day. So when I do I hope to get what I pay for, or else I am quite disappointed and frustrated. Our stay at this hotel was unfortunately a case of the latter, mainly because of the quality of the room. I booked an executive suite for $544 per night for a weekend getaway for my wife and 2 small children. The room was spacious and had a great view of the river, but it ended there. You know that feeling when you first enter a hotel room that you paid a lot of money for, and you hold your breath for a moment hoping you are not disappointed? When we entered the room and looked around, my wife was quiet. After 15 years I know that means that she is less than impressed, but does not want to make me feel bad by saying anything right away. All 3 lampshades were broken, loose, and wobbly. The dated marble countertop of the bar was gooped in place all round the edges with old white caulk. The wallpaper was tired and worn, like many other things in the room. The next day my wife told me that she had trouble sleeping because she had found hair balls and other junk in the corners where the vacuum can't quite reach, and in front of the bathroom vanity. She was grossed out, and I felt ripped off. I would not recommend this hotel unless they shut it down and do a full renovation. Oh, and don't eat the buffet breakfast. The pancakes were like vulcanized rubber...the same stuff they use to make bowling balls. My 11 yr old daughter asked for my help to cut them, but even I could not do it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: kabecker
Reviews.Content: 2 nights stayed at this property.. Here are my feelings: Pros- Great Location- 7 minute walk to Magnificent Mile shopping and good location to other popular spots Rooms are roomy for a big city location Rooms are nicely appointed, the beds are comfortable and the AC system works without making loud noises which I am finding at alot of hotels Bathroom is very nice and towels are very luxurious Big HDTV Valets are very helpful with getting you a cab Rooms arent boxy and are a bit unique. Its a square but one side is curved. Cons Shower is a big motel-esque- shallow shower, not great waterpressure in our room Internet is crazy expensive at $14.95 a day and slow NO closet space- You live out of a suitcase Did I mention the internet at $14.95 a day is a bit ridiculous? Noises from other doors closing are definitely audible, but not necessarily harrasing I did enjoy the stay and found the property to be worthy of its 4 star rating. I just wish Marriott would do something about the inflated internet charges. I typically look for hotels that dont charge for internet, but I was staying here on points so I wont complain this time.

Reviews.Title: “rock solid”
Reviews.Author: intsik
Reviews.Content: the renaissance is located on the north end of the loop, along the river. location is ideal for both business in the loop, and leisure activities in river north. there are bus lines that run outside the hotel, and the subway is a block away. the rooms were nice, clean and spacious, though it showed signs of wear, and could use a refurbishment. the beds were very comfortable. internet is free in the lobby. the staff were businesslike and polite. nothing remarkable, but it was very solid hotel. no complaints here

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Must live out of your suitcase.”
Reviews.Author: RunMarathon
Reviews.Content: The location was great. the room, however did not have any dressers, so the 3 of us had to live out of our suitcase for 5 days. When I asked if this was the custom in Chicago, I was told that it was the architect's idea. I don't know who was more clueless - the architect / designer who thought no clothes storage was a good idea for travelers, or the people at the Renaissance who agreed it seemed like a good plan. This is the kind of information that needs to be mentioned when booking the room; if I had know there were no bureaus / dressers, I would not have stayed here. This is definitely a deal breaker for me and my family. There was only member on the concierge staff that was helpful. the others seemed to be a bit clueless. We got different information on the same topic when we asked different people. It is conveniently located across the street from the river walk, which is a great place to run. It leads out to the Navy Pier, and is a nice walk in the evening. The breakfast was part of the room rate; the buffet had a nice mix of traditional breakfast foods as well as fruit, yogurt, an omelet station. Kids could make their own pancakes. The pancakes were cooked and kids could add whatever they wanted. If I had know there were no dressers to put clothes, I would not have chosen this hotel for my family. It was quite inconvenient to live out of a suitcase; there are hotels in the same vicinity that would have worked just as well. We took a high room, but could still hear the train late into the night, and early in the morning. the swimming pool was nice. This hotel would do well to let people know what is in the vicinity and what is available on site. It wasn't until we were leaving that we realize they offered complimentary bicycles. that would have been a great way to tour the city. Overall, this hotel is just plain average. Not the best we've stayed in, but certainly not the worse. If we ever travel to Chicago again, we will not stay here, and will make sure we ask about dressers for clothes storage.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay at a hotel, bar none!”
Reviews.Author: G10b3tr0tt3r
Reviews.Content: I had to fudge the date that I stayed at the Renaissance...I was actually there in July '08, but I am guessing (and hope) it hasn't changed much from when I was there. The hotel is beautiful, clean, comfortable and in the most wonderful location you can imagine. You are within walking distance of the Magnificent Mile, Millennium park, the Chicago theater and across the street from the river. Such a stunning location. (Let me also mention that there was fresh water in the lobby for the guests, which I drank daily and was so grateful it was there during those hot Chicago days). The service was wonderful. At the time I was there, the concierge, Jonathan (I hope he is still there), was incredibly helpful and pleasant. He hooked us up with some great stuff, including line bypass and a free appetizer at Gino's pizza. He genuinely wanted to make sure we had a fantastic stay. Just an all around wonderful stay...it was difficult to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gqkz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Renaissance Chicago for a few months now and have had a tremendous experience. First, the location is ideal. On the river, in the loop right across from the Trump Tower. Within walking distance of the bean, or Michigan avenue, or only 3 blocks to where I had to work. The rooms are typical Renaissance. Nice, clean, comfortable bed, nice linens, aveda bathroom products, starbucks coffee in room. What really made the experience was two people at the Front desk, Colleen and Erin. They have both been able to go the extra mile to make my stay nice and welcoming. Whether it's a room with a nice view, or nearly permanently holding onto my luggage, they have always been able to make my stay more enjoyable. The hotel has a nice hot tub, one of the better workout facilities for a hotel, and the bar downstairs is actually nice / busy. I can't imagine anywhere else that would be a better stay / value in this area of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Suited our needs for a week's stay at a conference!”
Reviews.Author: AnewMunsterfan
Reviews.Content: Small hotel room but nicely updated with all the amenities you need. Many restaurants, nice bar, great access to downtown and enjoyable stay. I look for comfortable beds and the ability to get a good night's sleep. Mission accomplished.

Reviews.Title: “Quite disappointed. Will not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Mozsacan
Reviews.Content: Check-in OK - I would rate the clerk as "neutral" - neither friendly nor unfriendly. The concierge was not only unfriendly but unhelpful. She sounded annoyed that I asked her a few questions on restaurants & directions. Hard to understand how such people manage to stay in the hospitality industry. Is the talent pool so depleted? Although our reservation was clear that we were several people staying in the room, there were only toilietries for 1 person. When I called to get extras, they sent housekeeping up with 1 tiny bottle of shampoo and one of conditioner on a platter!? The room was OK but had no coffee machine; also no additional toiletries like a shower cap. Hotel location is good, almost right across from the new Trump tower. Anyway, for $240/night, don't think it represents good value in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the view!”
Reviews.Author: Jan185
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Chicago and our third stay at the Renaissance. This is a truly lovely property with conscientious service. In our mind there is no other hotel to stay in while in Chicago. The location is excellent with all the major attractions within walking distance or a short cab ride away. However, the reason we continue to return to the Renaissance is the view. It is definitely worth the extra money to book a river view room. The Chicago river front by night is breath taking! Book a stay and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Cant go wrong with a Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: Noush01
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip which was at the same time as Lolapalooza. The location is good, the staff is nice and friendly. Ikram at Guest Services and Abraham at the Front desk really stood out and were great! However next time I think I'll stay at the WIT across the street as that was a really hip hotel or at the Marriott Downtown which is a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Business in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: BeachnutsinMissouri
Reviews.Content: Another stay in a Marriott property and I was reminded why I don't stay anwhere else. Whether it is a downtown or resort property these folks are always on their game. I've stayed at this Renaissance before but not for several years. Lobby staff and housekeeping where good as always. The concierge loung at this property was connected to three floors by a spiral staircase. Best food and beverage I've had at a Marriott brand concierge lounge. The lobby bar was also great for gathering. A bar is ussually a bar but this one had a really good design with lots of seperate spaces all sofas and chairs. No little round tables surrounded arm chairs. For a stay in downtown Chicago this property goes to the top of my list!

Reviews.Title: “Don't ask the consierge!”
Reviews.Author: Marcia58
Reviews.Content: Let me say first that the location is GREAT!! The rooms are typical nice hotel and overall, our stay was fine...however, we had two issues... First, the concierges were of no use...if you are looking for ANY help finding your way around or getting resturant ideas, book elsewhere, (or ask Brandon, a bellman out front). Secondly, housekeeping came very late each day...5:30 ish...this is a problem when we were out all day and then wanted to get cleaned up and rested to go out in the evening. The ONLY day they came early was on the day of check-out when they knocked on the door at 8:15am!! The stay was all ok but can't say it would be my top pick to return there. (Loved Chicago!!)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location in an amazing city safe and convenient”
Reviews.Author: MikTheWho
Reviews.Content: As we got use to finding our way around Chicago we really appreciated the location right at the heart of downtown Chicago. Staff very friendly and obliging for all requests for assistance. Room was very clean and kept smart and fresh for our stay.Would have liked some tea making facilities and got caught out the first few days with the $5 bottle of water in the room so read all the labels and cards displayed around the room to ensure you maximise all services to your preference. Staff on the desk, concierge and staff out front were great ambassodors for the hotel and Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service - Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: michstate1fan
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Renissance hotel in downtown Chicago on the evening of 06/12/2010 along with a group of girl friends that were in town for the weekend. We had a terrible experience through the less than 24hrs that we were there. To start off, when the reservation was made (under the name of Lisa Oleson), we were told that we could check-in at 3pm on June 12th. We ended up getting to the hotel a bit early around 2:40pm and were told that our room would not be ready until approximately 3:15pm-3:20pm because the room was clean but a manger just needed to inspect the room. Because this was just shortly after our original reservation time, we were content with waiting. Time continued to roll by while we waited in another friend's room. We continued to call the front desk approximately every 30-45 minutes because it was taking so long and we had dinner reservations at 6pm so we had to leave the hotel at 5:30. It finally reached 4:45pm and I called the front desk and asked to speak to a manager because I was so displeased with the arrangements (or lack there of). I was told that the manager was calling me from a different line so I was instructed to hang up and they would be calling me immediately. I hung up the phone and never heard from them. A steward came down to our friend's room to inform us our room was finally ready at 5pm so we rushed down in a hurry to get ready for an evening out in 30 minutes. I was enraged by the whole ordeal but decided to leave it be and not make a huge deal of it so as not to spoil the weekend. However, things did not stop there. When we picked up our car from valet the next morning, we waited approximately 20-30 minutes before we went and asked what the hold up was. The person at the window said the valet had our keys and our car would be up shortly. It was at that point that we noticed our keys hanging on the wall and informed them that in fact the valet did not have our keys. So after watching people come after us and get their vehicles first for 30-40 minutes, we finally received our car. Overall, this was an extremely poor experience. We spent $350 for one night at the hotel and I don't feel it was worth even a quarter of that price. I was completely disappointed and would never recommend this hotel to anyone in the future because not only did we have a very poor experience, but the staff (manager included) was completely apathetic to our needs and inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Antarctic
Reviews.Content: We stayed over a long weekend and got a very good rate on a corner room overlooking the river. Two rooms, a large bathroom and another toilet with washbasin; the facilities were excellent for the price. The restaurant overlooking the river has a very good view and a substantial and varied good quality buffet for breakfast. The dinner was fine but not the best food I have ever eaten. All the staff we met were friendly and very helpful. We both liked the ambience of the hotel and would stay again if visiting Chicago in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Could hardly get better”
Reviews.Author: RobCh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chicago Renaissance for 3 nights early May on a romantic escapade. This hotel met all of our expectations. We strongly suggest you book a "river view" room to enjoy a great view of the Chicago river. Our room on the 18th floor had a fantastic view which we enjoyed a lot given the fact that the hotel's bay windows are very large. The rooms have been remodelled, are a decent size, very clean and sound proofed (from inside and outside noise). The bathroom is large and comfortable and offers dimmed lighting. Service at the front desk was truly exceptionnal (Susan ... wow !) as was service in the rest of the hotel. We were given complimentary club access and this was great as well (enough food at night to have en entire dinner there...!). As for the location: it just cannot be beat ! Really this hotel cannot be flawed. Book it with full confidence !

Reviews.Title: “OK, but with as many hotels Chicago has to offer, I'd choose to stay elsewhere next time.”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter911
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in this hotel. The first was with a group of girlfriends, and that stay was great, but mostly because we were not there much so there was less of a chance for a screw up. However, this last time, we went to Chicago for my daughter's spring break, and it was a different story. At check in, there was one guy working the front desk. ONE. And it is a 500 room hotel! We waited forever to check in, and when we finally did, he was completely indifferent to us. I have a feeling he was sick of getting beat up all night. Once we were in, we got to our room and our first impression was a good one because there was music playing and dim lighting to welcome us, but upon further inspection, we found DIRT. A lot of it. I took pictures. Our ironing board was broken as well, and because we didn't want to get charged for it, we told the front desk.. but I'm pretty sure they thought we had something to do with it. The lounge is really nice and it was Earth Day, so they shut all the lights off and we enjoyed drinks by candlelight, which was nice. Location was good and there is a large selection of restaurants nearby. The lady at concierge sounded like a broken record when she recommended places though... she might be earning some sort of kick back from a breakfast place a few blocks away! We also wanted to go to Ginos, and when we asked her directions, she kept telling us 100 other places to go, and refused to tell us directions to Ginos. Finally we walked away from her and grabbed a cab. BTW Gino's isn't as far as she lead us to believe. The next day, we were going to the acquarium and we asked which direction it was so we could start walking and she kept saying "you can't walk there... you can't walk there". Well, fine... we proved her wrong:) Oh and one last thing... security is so tight it made me feel a little unsafe. One evening my daughter had to go to the bathroom so she ran into the hotel in front of us and security stopped her and made her wait until we got there to go to the bathroom, and she almost wet herself. Really... she's 10... she's not about to commit armed robbery! We go to Chicago quite often and honestly, with as many hotels to chose from, I'm not sure I'd go here again.

Reviews.Title: “Total Rip-off !!”
Reviews.Author: Garcia745
Reviews.Content: Came to this hotel for a conference. Although the hotel was clean and John, the parking valet was super nice and VERY helpful, we really weren't happy with the hotel. For the prices they charge, they could add a few more simple things that the lower priced hotels include in their room rate. Things like free WIFI would be helpful - instead of charging $14.95 a DAY !! I can get free WIFI at the McDonald's or the bar down the street for heaven's sake !! No fridge in room - would be helpful to keep drinks cold. Poor choice of television stations. Couldn't watch the hockey game in my room. I could watch it in the bar in the hotel, but not in my room ?? Maid service on the first day - found my sample size shampoos and soaps lying on the floor by my door - the bathroom is 3 feet away - but they were lying on the floor in my room ?? Oh - and don't forget the parking situation. Valet parking - you can't park your own car - they charge you $49 a day to have parking on the premises !! If it wasn't for the conference, I would not stay here and will never stay here again ! Get better value at MUCH less expensive hotels !!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome suite with amazing view!”
Reviews.Author: CarlsbadTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Renaissance for 3 nights in one of their suites. We loved the room and the view was the best we've had in Chicago. Staff was excellent and we enjoyed our meal through room service on one of the nights after a long day out exploring the town. We will definitely stay here again next time we're in town. Our platinum status got us into the concierge lounge for two of our days and the evening offerings were quite good. The breakfast was more than adequate for our needs and we really appreciated the access to beverages during those days.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location & Service in Chicago!!!”
Reviews.Author: bogeyboi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance Chicago Downtown for a week on business and couldn't have asked for a better time. As a rewards member I received a Chicago River view (with an awesome view of Trump's new tower and the boats coming and going). The service was exceptional and everyone aimed to please. Room was very spacious with flat screen TV, sitting area with coffee table, bay window overlooking Michigan Ave view, bed very large and comfortable, bathroom also very spacious. Fitness Center was very nice with tons of cardio and free weight equipment. Only knock was ceiling was too low for folks like me who jump rope. Didn't try the hotel's restaurant/bar (why would you with all those options to the right/left of you). Excellent location with Michigan Ave just two blocks over, shopping, great restaurants, etc. I try to stay at a Marriott wherever I go and right now this one is tops (with the Renaissance Blackstone Hotel a very close 2nd). You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: KurtBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: Marriott Gold member - loved the concierge lounge views, atmosphere and service. Front desk clerk was great at check-in and check-out. Great location, very pleasant, spacious room with incredible view ofr river and beautiful lobby. Great fitness center. Only complaint was overly priced drinks at Nico.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: IndianaTravelmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with school age children on a weekend night. Location is ideal-walking distance to many interesting restaurants and close to stores of Michigan Avenue and Art Institute. Public areas are clean and attractive. Pool was a priority for us and this seems to be one of the few downtown Chicago hotels that has one. Pool area was nice although pool was a little cool(attendant came by and said they'd had problems controlling temp lately-too warm or too cool but she would turn temp up). Two issues during our stay-one room smelled a bit of cigar smoke(in spite of no smoking sign) and no hot water in the shower in one of 2 rooms. When mentioned these issues to front desk at checkout(we just used the other shower as it was late when we discovered the problem) they apologized but made no offer to adjust bill which seems like it would have been appropriate. However, hotel still seemed like a good bargain for Chicago. Parking fee seemed on par with what we have paid in big cities

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KBGA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a prime location, with easy access to bus and train. Within walking distance of the major attractions. Room was clean and well furnished. Pool was wonderfully warm. Alas packed with kids sometimes but that's not the hotel's fault they have a desirable pool. Concierge breakfast was a bit disappointing for this level of Marriott hotel. Also beware, they will not provide breakfast coupons to Platinum Members on the weekends because they say the Concierge room is closed anyway. We ate in the hotel restaurant. Food was good but not worth the price tag (although the view did add value). Service is good. We were there just after New Years and they were understaffed but not stressed. Definately recommend this for a place to stay for business and also if you are vacationing in the city and want to see the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel, some nickel & diming...”
Reviews.Author: kironb
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights in Jan 2010 at the legal firm corporate rate of $139/night The Good: - Comfortable bed, very clean room, spacious bathroom - Very good fitness center - at least a dozen cardio machines, two sets of free weights, two workout benches and a few weight training machines - Conveniently located in the Loop, 2 minute walk to Magnificent Mile area - Starbucks cafe is accessible through the underground path so no need to put on a jacket to get breakfast or a coffee! The Bad: - The area near the window was very cold so I had to crank up the heat - this caused parts of the room to boil and other parts to remain cold - $14.95 for Internet access is pricey - Hilton should be a leader in the large hotel chain market and dispense with these fees across all their hotel lines. - I didn't have a car, but valet parking was $49/day - that's as expensive as some cheap motels! I've never rented a car in Chicago, so this might be the going rate for downtown parking but it still seems somewhat steep. - The hotel business center is actually a FedEx/Kinkos so you have to pay for basically everything.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the middle of it all!”
Reviews.Author: CarlaB6
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel. It's located between the Hancock tower and the Shed aquarium. We walked to both locations from the hotel. The concierge desk offered wonderful advise for activities and restaurants. Only warning, parking is pricey!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Northwoods_Legend
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here a few days after Christmas and found the hotel to be very clean, large rooms and in a great location. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The location is deal for walking throughout the City or to catch the elevated train, with stop right next door. We didn't have a car so did not have to pay the excessive parking charge - but that is typical at any Chicago hotel. The only negative was that the business center is not open on the weekends, however we were able to check in for our flight and print out boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Place, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Genesis803
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its excellent location in the Loop. The location proved invaluable as the weather was very cold and snowy. Still we were able to get everywhere we needed to go by CTA bus and EL train, both of which stop right outside the hotel. I cannot say enough good about the location. If I stay here again, the location will be the reason. The rest of the hotel was nice but nothing spectacular. The staff was friendly and helpful. Internet cost was $14 per day and room service was way overpriced. The price we paid was a little higher than other similar hotels in the area but the proximity to transit routes made up for this. The noise from the EL train was noticiable but did not keep us awake as we were on the 21st floor.

Reviews.Title: “All Around Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: onthego1937
Reviews.Content: We stay there every year on the last weekend before Christmas. The location is great for shopping and going to the theatre. The rooms are clean and nicely decorated...most have an interesting view. The staff is very freely. The hotle has many little extra touches. The Sunday breakfast is good with a nice view. It would also be a great place to take a family. It is in the center of thins.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: PumpkinSeeds
Reviews.Content: Excellent suite, staff, food, location etc. Could not have been more pleased. River view fantastic, perfect location for thearte, shopping, food, everything. Will be returning FOR SURE!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely room, nice meal”
Reviews.Author: withkidstravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a suite with riverfront views. Loved it. I have stayed there before; the thing I recalled best were the broiler-like heaters they have to keep people warm outside. Pleased that I am not taller or my hair would have sizzled! Check-in was efficient, lunch was quite good, room service good, wake up call on time and bed comfortable. Walking distance to almost everything downtown. Very convenient and would stay there again. Wonderful restaurants all around.

Reviews.Title: “Ups and Downs”
Reviews.Author: PatWisconsin
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for business and stayed with another colleague in a room. The room was very clean, but the hotel is a bit cheap when it comes to bathroom amenities. There were two of us booked in the room--why only one bath robe? Turn down service was spotty. One night we had a drink in the room; our wine glasses were taken but never returned until we called. There is a service called "Delighted to Service"----the person who answered when I called apparently wasn't told you were supposed to be friendly when a hotel guest calls! The bar in the hotel, Novo is a complete rip-off. One night 4 of us met for drinks. 2 of my friends ordered the special martinis at $11 each. When the first one arrived, we laughed and joked that the waitress must have been thristy since it wasn't even 3/4 full; the second maritini was also less then 3/4 full so we joked that the waitress must have tripped and spilled some. The friend who ordered an expensive wine got about 2 inches of wine, if that. The hotel does have great facilities for conferences which is why we were there. It is not cheap. I might stay there again, but if they want to rate the hotel as a 4 star, the overall experience needs to be upgraded.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: mightaswellbaby
Reviews.Content: Other reviewers had it right - the hotel and rooms are nice (pretty standard for business travel), and the location is excellent. I had a standard king room which was quite large and comfortable. The room and bathroom were clean, and housekeeping was thorough every day (though I could do without the excessive air freshener). Room service variety and efficiency was above average. There was noise from the nearby El, even on the 18th floor, but not enough to disturb me (I sleep with ear plugs - other travelers might be more sensitive). Overall, a solid choice for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: roerunner
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel and the location. We stayed here for a Sat. and Sun., and would have spent another night if the hotel hadn't been full. Everyone on the staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and roomier than we expected for a center city hotel. The rooms were also very quiet, althouhg you could here the El if you were on the backside of the hotel. The location was also excellent and we walked to restaurants, the Sears (Willis) Tower, and the Chicago River boat tour that left from Michigan and Wacker Dr. Of course, we had very good weather (chilly, but no rain) or we woudn't have been able to do this - probably would have taken taxis, since driving and parking are a hassle if you're not used to it. We did not move our car for 2 days. We did not eat here so I can't rate that, though they do have a Starbucks on premise which we used for morning coffee after finishing the small pot of coffee in our room. There were just too many other places to try for food. I have two recommendations that might help others: On weekends, use one of the parking lots within a block of the hotel, since there is plenty of parking available, and they charge a lot less than the $50 per night we paid to park at the Renaissance. Also, if you don't have to be on the river, there are several other hotels by Marriott that are very close to this one, but are less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Solid”
Reviews.Author: qaz123
Reviews.Content: This is a solid business hotel with clean rooms and a central location. I booked a "Club" room, and it was quite large with a huge bathroom offering a separate tub and shower and a large single sink vanity. The room itself was clean with pretty standard international hotel style furniture and a 42 inch flat screen TV. The breakfast offerings in the Club Room were a little uninspiring; I did not have the opportunity to try any of the other hotel's dining outlets. The hotel is located right on the river and was quite near to my meeting locale. I would say that this property is a solid B+/A- business hotel--it is not a trend setting property in any way, but it serves its purpose well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service and River View, but a few negatives”
Reviews.Author: MaineCharm
Reviews.Content: In a word, the Renaissance front desk staff is outstanding. They are unfailingly polite, helpful, cheerful, and go above & beyond to assist. The location is superb, being convenient to both the Loop, Mag Mile, and all buses and trains. There is no sight more beautiful than the view of the river from one of the river view rooms. The view alone is worth the price of the stay, even at the outrageous convention period prices. The bedding and basic comfort is satisfactory. Rooms are very quiet, although you can hear the most obnoxious conventioneers talking loudly to each other as they return to their rooms in the wee hours. Internet is $15/day per computer. There are some negatives, none of which are any fault of the staff, but rather the fault of the people responsible for the interior design and maintenance/renewal of the structure itself. The operation of the heating/AC system in our room was unreliable. And an icy cold draft at the window ledge prevented sitting there in the evening to enjoy the view (without a blanket!) The water temperature in the shower is erratic, constantly going from hot to cold to hot to cold, so that you really have to shower with one hand close to the faucet for immediate adjustments. One colleague had very inadequate water pressure in their shower, but got moved to a room with better facilities. There was almost no storage for clothes and misc items. You get a closet and two nightstand drawers, that's it. There's no dresser or any other storage except two tiny drawers in the minibar. On the plus side, there is a decent-sized room safe, although the metal edges are so sharp and rough you have to be really careful if you store a wide laptop in it, to avoid damage. One note of warning: the hotel restaurant is a dismal disappointment if you like your food properly prepared and served. The Starbucks in the lobby is great, and if you like Chinese dumplings, the Wow Bao in the lower level is extremely affordable ($1.39 per dumpling, two are sufficient for lunch) if you want a quick bite. Oh, and I should mention that while our room was exceptionally clean and well-kept, another colleague's room had dust on every surface. Maybe a room that has been empty awhile should be rechecked before allowing the next guest in. In closing, I would not hesitate to stay at the Renaissance again if a river view room was available, because the staff is also so wonderful, but given the lack of storage space and annoying shower, you really have to consider places like the Sofitel where your room will have not only more conveniences but also many little luxuries and trouble-free showering.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay In Chicago”
Reviews.Author: wintersummer
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Renaissance Hotel. It's close to the subway, so it's a breeze to get from airport to hotel. We were upgraded to a suite overlooking the Chicago River - what a delightful way to spend some time in Chicago. We spent every morning and evening just sitting and looking out over the traffic on the streets, sidewalks, and river. Service at this hotel is wonderful, rooms are comfortable, location simply cannot be beat. A great place, in every single way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: stefie1234
Reviews.Content: What a good experience we had with the Renaissance. We booked on priceline for a really reasonable price. Was so excited to find out we would be staying in downtown at a four star hotel for less than $100.00. We went to the U2 concert at the stadium (amazing!). It was a bit of a walk, but we are young and loved exploring the city. We would absolutely return and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for exploring Chicago”
Reviews.Author: LOLBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 1 bedroom suite with husband and 4 year old child for 5 nights. The suite was huge and had plenty of room for our little one to play without getting under our feet. The hotel has a great pool area and spectacular views overlooking Chicago River. The location was perfect for exploring all that Chicago has to offer with the Trolley tour stop across the road and boat tours 2 minutes walk away. My daughter's favourity memory of Chicago was buying Garrett's popcorn (Cheese and Caramel mix) which is around the corner from the hotel. The concierge was extremely helpful with tips for sight-seeing with a small child, which made our stay even more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “First rate hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JAAHuntingdon_UK
Reviews.Content: Nicely positioned overlooking river. Close to public transportation. Large well decorated and clean twin room. Coffee machine in room. Reasonable price for the quality of the hotel. Friendly and helpful staff. Restaurant nice but menu does not change - thus we ate out most of the time. Nice swimming pool & jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: BGS53
Reviews.Content: We could not be more pleased with our three night stay at this lovely hotel. It is the perfect location for walking to all that Chicago has to offer, from sightseeing to museums. Our riverview room was wonderful. What a great view to come back to every day & night. We highly recommend the nearby Shaw's Oyster Bar for great food, music & service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: CariBelle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for NeoCon 2009 and can't wait to return. Great location, great staff, good food on site and the rooms were very clean and comfy. My only wish is that we had a room facing the river, but that was our own fault for waiting to book the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, exceptional location and clean...staff not so much!”
Reviews.Author: PaTwid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance for a trip with my daughter for a trip to American Girl and other shopping. It was a great location...close to everything! Rooms were clean, spacious and quiet. Pool was a little small but did the job! My major complaint was the concierge service...they were clueless! There idea of help was to draw a dot on the map and sent us on our way. When asking to get a menu from a nearby restaurant ...she printed it out and then said "this is all I can give you,...the printer cut it off", and walked away. All I want to know is when you get off work wher do you eat? Only locals know where the good stuff is...right? She finally said a lot of people go to Giordanos...let me tell you as an Italian american I was offended by the quality of pizza...disgusting! Tasted like cardboard (like a frozen pizza that I paid $50 dollars for ) absolutely awful..how do you screw up pizza? The next night we ended up at Catch 31 next door was really good. An absolute must is a homeage ginger ale at Bao Wow...I still miss them! Get a bus pass for the length of your stay, you won't be disappointed! If you are bringing children, we saw "Aladdin" at the William Shakespear Theatre at Navy Pier and it was worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amazing river view”
Reviews.Author: bella1078
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel in lieu of the Marriott Mag Mile (I'm a Marriott Rewards member) based on TripAdvisor reviews and I'm so glad I did! For starters this is a beautiful property and every staff person we encountered (especially Kelli and Bill at the front desk) was helpful and accomodating. The best part in terms of being a tourist however is that the El (State/Lake stop) is right outside the back door of the hotel - this made travel to/from the airport a breeze along with all of our sightseeing travels as well. Large room with a bay window (that opened!) overlooking the river, bathroom was spacious as well....a wonderful reprieve from the hectic city at night.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, comfortable hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: siabniac
Reviews.Content: Large chain hotel but very comfortable, pleasant surroundings and staff. Very well located for business and good for tourists too. Great selection of restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Scenic river view in the heart of Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: wb8200
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Renaissance to anyone looking for a great stay in the Chicago area. It is perfectly positioned in Chicago's South Loop, Theater District. Everything is just a short walk away. I recommend requesting a River View room, as the view from most downtown Chicago hotels can be a bit bland (e.g. skyscrapers, construction, etc.) The staff at the Renaissance is top notch, constantly exceeding my expectations. The rooms are fairly spacious, and well adorned with a comfortable, modern decor. If you're looking to go on a weekend getaway in the Chicago area, give the Renaissance a try. I assure you, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, clean, great location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: w0rldtraveler007
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything it aspired to be, a clean, business friendly, classy hotel in an excellent location. The rooms are comfortable, staff friendly, and lobby swanky. The hotel has a nice pool and the fitness center is decent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tropicalfan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location on the Chicago river, walking distance to shopping, parks, sightseeing and great restaurants. i would not discourage anyone from staying here- the rooms were large and comfortable, with great marble bathrooms. I gave it an average because the services I used were just OK. The front desk was always busy and understaffed, the concierge seemed tired of dealing with tourists, and although very hot outside, the staff could not seem to keep the large server of water filled. But the location and rooms were more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “great!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaTravelgal2009
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, great amenities - would definitely stay here again and will recommend it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Chicago Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Travel_velocity
Reviews.Content: This great hotel is directly across from the Chicago River so definitely spend a bit more for a river room...it will be worth it and you will have a full on view of Marina City (the famous corn cob buildings) and of course the river itself, including the Mies Van Der Rowe IBM building and the side and backside of the Wrigley building among others. The staff are very nice, the bed very comfortable and checkout was a breeze as we had bags packed for two weeks and called up the bellman who put our bags in a car for our return trip to the airport. The hotel is next to the El (elevated rail), so getting around is a breeze. It's likely to be a bit more expensive than the average hotel, but if you get a high river room view, it will be worth it. Location is fantastic, as you can walk north across the river for access to jazz and blues and great restaurants in the evening, and during the day you can go south for culture if on holiday or on business. The hotel has a touch of elegance for a fair but not ridiculuous price.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the $”
Reviews.Author: explorepossibilities
Reviews.Content: If given the option, we stay at Renaissance hotels. This hotel wasn't as nice as other Renaissance hotels. No complaints because the price was terrific, but I would look at other hotels before booking this one, because there are cheaper w/ = quality. The rooms are small (bathrooms are nice size). The lobby was nice, the front desk was friendly. However, the rooms reminded me of a renovated Crowne Plaza. The beds are comfortable, but I wasnâ€™t impressed with the pillows. We always get upgraded, but didnâ€™t here. We ordered room service one night and only one meal out of three was correct, when you are ordering a $12 grilled cheese, you expect perfection :-) The pool area was nice, but the hot tub didnâ€™t have enough water and it took well over hours upon reporting to get filled, I donâ€™t even know how long because we didnâ€™t stay any longer. In short, I would recommend this hotel to a friend if it was the right price, but there are other hotels I would first recommend. The location is okay, but I have enjoyed other locations more too. You might not be disappointed, but there are better deals out there. Oh, and parking is $49 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SavannahGal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed this hotel. The location on the river was perfect. It was centrally located between theater, shopping, and touring. It was in a bustling area but the room was very quiet. We were able to take public transportation from the airport and never needed a car. I walked everywhere . . . waterfront, Millennium Park, shopping, restaurants, etc. We only had to walk a block or two to the amazing Oriental Theater to see Wicked. Discount shopping world is within a five minute walk of the hotel (Filene's, Nordstrom Rack, H & M, Loehmann's, TJ Maxx, among others). Magnificent mile was also within walking distance. I would not miss the boat tour by the Chicago Architectural Foundation. It was right down the street on the river. The service at the hotel was good and the room was great. The bathroom was nicely appointed, the bedding was as nice as home, and our corner room was very spacious.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice That Will Keep You In The Loop”
Reviews.Author: majellin
Reviews.Content: The first time I went to Chi-town I stayed at a nice but far-flung hotel in one of the suburbs. This time (June 09) I stayed right in the Loop at the Chicago Renaissance and man what a difference that makes! This hotel is adjacent to the State/Lake CTA Station (the "el") and the Blue Line to O'Hare is only a short walk away. The hotel fronts the river and it seemed anything I wanted to see downtown was just a short walk away. I got a super deal on this hotel by booking in advance on their website (using the AAA Rate). The hotel was very clean, very modern and the room was comfortable with big European pillows on the bed. The staff was very professional and extremely helpful despite the size of the place and huge number of guests. They let me store my bags while I caught a Cubs game over at Wrigley Field. I would stay here again in a heartbeat and hope they keep offering good deals online for those of us who shop early. On my next trip to the Windy City, this is the first place I will check for rates/availability. AWESOME hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to Expectations”
Reviews.Author: TadTolle
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews on TripAdvisor before booking. I stay at Marriott a lot on business so used points to book 2 nights when my son and I went to Chicago to catch a Cubs game. The hotel is in a great location in the heart of downtown on the Chicago River. We walked to Navy Pier on Lake Michigan, about 30 min walk. The red line subway is 1 block away which will take you to the Cubs or White Sox games. The connsier was outstanding. There was a Harry Potter exhibit at the museum of history and industry. She recommended it after asking my son (8) if he liked Harry Potter. Great idea. Allof the staff were friendly. The last night it rained, so after returning from a day exploring, we rented a movie in the room and ordered room service. They have a children's menu ($5 each) which is unusual in nicer hotels. Food arrived in 15 minutes. There is an extensive breakfast buffett each morning, discount for children again. Overall, i'd stay here again on business or pleasure

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to EVERYTHING!”
Reviews.Author: Wolfpacker
Reviews.Content: We flew in to Chicago Midway airport and took the CTA Orange Line train right to the hotel! There is a CTA stop (State/Lake) literally at the back door of the hotel and the train ride is a snap at only $2.25 per rider (don't take a cab). Very nice. Check in was easy and quick. We booked the hotel trough PRICELINE.COM and got an awesome rate (that's why I'm giving it a good valuew rating). We ended up in a KING room on the 21st floor looking right down the river. Again, very nice indeed. The room was clean, the bathroom spacious, and my wife loved the complimentary robe. The Renaissance is within walking distance of just about everything in Chicago so if you come to the city and really want a CENTRAL location this place has it covered. There is a nice exercise area and this hotel actually has an indoor pool (fairly small), sauna and hot tub (nice for soaking after walking the city all day).

Reviews.Title: “Good, centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: edleo13
Reviews.Content: I spent 1 night at the Renaissance while on business. Room: The hotel is obviously a little older, however the rooms are large and the decor was clearly modernized very recently. I booked a corporate rate of $179/night, before tax, which seemed very reasonable to me for a downtown loop hotel in Chicago. Bed was comfortable and included enough pillows that even I could find one that I liked. Favorite things about the room: hotel is 100% non-smoking and has good bathroom amenities (i.e. mint thyme shampoo). Negatives: TV has no HD channels. Staff: Check-in was fast & friendly. Front desk recognized immediately that I booked a corporate rate that included free internet and even managed to get my bill correct the first time upon checkout. Wake up call was received promptly and made by an actual human (a luxury these days...). View & Location of Room: I had room #503 which is on the back side of the hotel (facing west) and had a view of virtually nothing except the top of what appeared to be a convention hall, a parking garage, and a residential building across the way. As I was in the room strictly to get some sleep, this wasn't an issue for me (check-in at 8:48pm, out by 7 the next morning). If you are light sleeper, you may want to consider asking for a room on one of the higher floors as the elevated trains run along Lake Street (immediately south of the hotel) and can be fairly noisy. Location: The hotel is located very, very centrally to both River North (i.e. Magnificent Mile shopping) and the Loop. It's basically 2 blocks east of Michigan Avenue if you walk along the river. The hotel is roughly 2 blocks from the Clark/Lake subway stop which has access to all lines (both elevated and underground) except the Red Line. Inbound, I took a taxi from O'Hare which ran me about $45 with tip. Outbound to O'Hare, I took the blue line, which only cost me $2.25 and was certainly faster (about 45 minutes) in rush hour traffic. Food: As it was late when I got in, I used room service for dinner. A club sandwich with fries ran me $21.30, including all fees and taxes. Delivery was prompt & the food was hot upon arrival. Overall, the Renaissance Chicago is a very comfortable hotel for both business and pleasure and I will certainly consider returning on my next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Windy City And Its Renaissance!”
Reviews.Author: KSergey
Reviews.Content: Well, we decided to go to Chicago on New Year holidays, and this was my first visit to the Windy City. I enjoyed it very much â€“ and to a great extent due to my stay at the Renaissance Chicago Hotel. As known, the first impression is the most important â€“ so, when I entered my one bedroom suite on the top floor and looked through the windowsâ€¦ W-O-O-O-O-O-W!!! The viewâ€¦it was fantastic! Great, Mighty, Powerful, Striking, Overwhelming - all these epithets could hardly describe my silent excitement and proud of the talented people who created all this urban architectural beauty for succeeding generations. Just in front of me, there was a bridged river, and on the top of its multilevel banks - the shining newly built Trump Tower, famous funny cylindrical twin â€œcornâ€� towers, as well as Chicago Tribune building and Michigan Avenue in remote. The whole city center is on your palm - really cool and unforgettable! I did a right thing when had chosen the Renaissance instead of the Marriott in Magnificent Mile, cause the last oneâ€™s location is rather trivial. Besides the beautiful view, I was very much impressed by the suiteâ€™s home likeness, you know. Relaxing colors of the walls and carpets, soft armchairs and coaches, lovely commodes and cupboards, flat plasma screens in each room, small fully equipped kitchen, a nice marble bathroom with all the amenities including robes and slippers, etc â€“ all these features made my stay truly comfy. And in general, the premises are nicely decorated: the lobby, bars, reception area got many interesting artifacts including vases, lamps, bookshelves, tables and other elements of professional design. Saying about the service Iâ€™d remark that itâ€™s regular. Anyway, to summarize the hotelâ€™s advantages and disadvantages, theyâ€™re the following. The pluses: ïƒ˜ The room cleaning and turndown service are at a very high level. ïƒ˜ The Front Desk staff are awesome. Due to the conciergeâ€™s absence, I â€œterrorizedâ€� them daily with a billion of questions concerning the city maps, sightseeing, entertainments, locations, routes, restaurants, weather, etc., and every time got sincere and appropriate assistance. And one day, I was talking by phone to a guy from a ticket agency that had not delivered prepaid tickets to me on time, and that guy spoke so fast like a machine-gun that I couldnâ€™t catch some important nuances of his â€œexplanationâ€�. So I asked a receptionist to help me with conversation, and he took my phone and started â€œtranslatingâ€� to me from live English into English for foreigners. Thank you again, guys, so much! ïƒ˜ The hotelâ€™s restaurant is very good. I had breakfast and dinner there almost daily and can admit that the service is outstanding. The food is delicious. Besides, its premises got a nice panoramic city view, especially at night lights. ïƒ˜ The breakfast at executive lounge is rather sufficient. ïƒ˜ For coffee lovers, thereâ€™s Starbucks inside the hotel. ïƒ˜ Thereâ€™s a taxi stand at the entrance with ready-to-ride cabs all the day round. ïƒ˜ Limousine service. ïƒ˜ Excellent price. The minuses: ïƒ˜ The thing that struck me most was the absence of the Concierge service at all during the whole period of my stay â€“ that looked ridiculous for the hotel of such a brand, as well as ïƒ˜ The absence of an internet terminal (while on vacation, many guests donâ€™t carry laptops with them for checking their mailboxes out just a couple of times, you know, and Iâ€™m not an exception); ïƒ˜ The mini-bar service is slow and sporadic â€“ without a phone call, the used drinks could have not been refilled for days; ïƒ˜ And, of course, the US Marriottâ€™s general principle that executive lounges are closed on weekends though in Europe and Asia they are open daily. That doesnâ€™t matter for business travelers, but vacationers (staying in executive rooms as well) usually arrive on weekends. Nevertheless, despite the aforementioned drawbacks of a limited partial character that obviously canâ€™t spoil the general positive impression of the hotel, Iâ€™d like to conclude that I truly liked the Renaissance Chicago and surely am ready to stay there again, but next time in summer â€“ with a river boat architectural tour and Chicago skyline small cruise ship dinner. Concerning what to do in Chicago in winter â€“ some strangerâ€™s tips: 1. Magnificent Mile. Itâ€™s enough a half-day walk to get your wallet empty and to relax for the whole stay afterwards. 2. Broadway musicals â€“ a very small choice but worth visiting. 3. Chicago Institute of the Arts â€“ unique institution with unbeatable collection of French impressionists â€“ a must. 4. The Field Museumâ€“ very impressive, bigger than its NYC famous rival. 5. Lyric Opera â€“ highly recommended. 6. Navy Pier â€“ fun and attractions. Nice views of the Lake of Michigan. Itâ€™s a whole sea, guys, now I understand why these lakes are called Great! 7. Sunday brunch at restaurant on the top floor of Hancock Tower â€“ a must. 8. Millennium Park. 9. Observation deck of Sears Tower. 10. Chicago Black Hawks and/or Chicago Bulls at United Arena â€“ a must. Bon Voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Practically Perfect In Every Way”
Reviews.Author: Tempesttost
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Chicago Hotel on March 28, 2009 for a one night stay. Upon arrival at 4:00pm the valet was overwhelmed (I guess too few employees working for the volume of guests arriving). After a wait our car was taken and we entered the hotel. The hotel has a beautiful clean, spacious lobby with a waterfall and a very serene feel. We were welcomed at the front desk with no wait by a very effective and friendly employee. Our assigned room was 1702 on the 17th floor. We highly recommend this room! It was at the end of the hall (very quiet, away from the elevators, etc.) and had windows on two walls looking out onto State Street. The views were incredible of the Chicago Theatre, river, and even Lake Michigan in the distance. The room was large and spacious, very clean, and well appointed. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was large, everything was wonderful. The rest of our stay was perfect until we went to leave the hotel. The valet was again overwhelmed and didn't seem to know where our car was parked! After a 20 minute wait our car was finally located and we departed. The hotel was great. The valet service was not (especially for the $45. fee we were charged for parking at the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Big Rooms In The City”
Reviews.Author: TheDocsGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the second half of our trip to Chicago. The first half we stayed at the Marriott Mag Mile. The rooms at the Renaissance are nice and spacious in comparison...not a typical city hotel room size. Room had seating area and sep bedroom both with large bay style window facing river...great view! Also one half and one full bath with sep tub/shower. Bathrooms were also quite large. It is walking distance to pretty much everything and is situated on the river with great views. We decided to valet (47 usd) because they told us that if you self park, it is like 5 or so dollars less, but you *do not* have in and out privlege...we were planning on driving so it was just easier to valet. There is a "spa" which is a shared area with the pool, fitness center, steam room, and lockers all shared....I think the lady said they only had 2 treatment rooms. Everything was new and very clean. Good equipment in fitness center and pool was clean as was steam room. Concierge lounge was a step above the regular Marriott as far as food quality and service. We had dinner one night in the on site restaurant, it was a two for 99 pre fixe meal (steak, veggie, salad, desert and bottle of wine) that actually was quite good. We loved our time in Chicago and when we go back, this hotel will be our first choice. Mainly because of the large rooms, river views and concierge service.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous wedding reception here at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sheilathornton1
Reviews.Content: the wedding reception at this hotel was the best i have ever been to. the food, the setting which was on the balcony was just breathtaking the staff could not have done more to make everyone feel welcome. thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, Awesome Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: IrishYanks
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff upgraded us to a huge corner suite overlooking the river/lake & State St (iconic Chicago Theater sign) and sent us a bottle of champagne to help us celebrate our anniversary. We had a great stay, and definitely recommend it for a night in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Suzy_Shopper
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd Renaissance hotel I have stayed at recently, and I have to say, I'm enjoying these properties. They really take care of you and service really seems to be a top priority for this hotel chain. I was given a really nice end room with two large windows facing the Chicago theater. The room was very spacious, contemporary and clean. There's a whole mini mall attached to the hotel so you don't have to walk outside in the freezing cold - - there's a small little store attached that serves Starbucks or you can walk inside the building and find a whole Starbucks store. There's a neat little fastfood-like dumpling restaurant that's great for a quick bite. The location can't be beat - - i could practically walk to all my meetings. There was great shopping nearby and the L stops were there too, even though i didn't use it. I really enjoyed my visit. I would totally stay at this hotel again for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at this downtown Chicago property”
Reviews.Author: SeminarTrekker
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at this downtown Chicago property. After arriving early into O'hare from a red eye from San Francisco. Check in was smooth and fast. I received a room on the top floor and music was playing when I entered the room. The room was was good size with plenty of lights. The bathroom water pressure was good as was the temperature control. The bathroom was clean. The bed was comfortable. The room was cleaned well every day. I asked for quiet room though the property is next to the elevated train, the noise from the train did not bother me. There was a mini fridge in the room which was a plus. The onsite restaurant was excellent. Also the concierge lounge offered good snacks and breakfast. This propert is very walkable to many downtown sites. There are two Dunkin Donuts around the corner as is there a drugstore, McDonalds and Borders. I highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoCubsGo08
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel as part of a group getaway vacation for couples. The hotel is gorgeous, the rooms very nice, and the location was great. I know this may be a strange thing to comment on, but the lobby smelled great. We used Marriott points to stay there, and it was well worth it. We've stayed at other Renaissance hotels, but this was one of the nicest. Also, there's a Lettuce Entertain you restaurant at the bottom called Wao Bao. If you like Asian food, definitely give it a try (especially the curry chicken).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel away from Mich Ave hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: candygirlMichigan
Reviews.Content: We are frequent Marriott travellers and find that Renaissance hotels are usually a step above Marriott. This hotel was a little disappointing compared to other Rennaisance hotels, as about the same as a Marriott. Still very nice, but doesn't compare to visits at other hotels. We liked the location as it was close to everything but still far enough away so that the area was less congested. The hotel bar wasn't very happening so if you are looking to have some cocktails, walk across the river and go the Crimson Lounge which is right next to the House of Blues. Overall, the experience at this hotel was pleasant, but will opt for the Marriott on Michigan Avenue for our next Chicago trip.

Reviews.Title: “Windy City Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Brklynrider
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a Thursday and Friday night in early December. The hotel was decorated for Christmas and looked very nice. The check in was a breeze. My room was a very nice/corner room #2301. As previous guests have noted the trains can be heard all the way up the back side of the hotel. I for one did not find this a problem at all. Maybe it's being from NYC the noise was not bad. It's not honking horns type of noise POSITIVES = Nice newly renovated rooms with large-flat screen tvs. Ipod Docking stations. Bathrooms were very spacious and had nice amenities. Concierge Lounge had good selection for breakfast foods and evening appetizers. Location - this is right near it all basically from tourist attractions to retail stores and good restaurants. There is a Borders bookstore next door as well as Macy's and other big stores. Cabs were always waiting right outside and the train stop is next door too. Concierge recommended Naha and Sepia restaurants for our two nights there. Both were outstanding - highly suggest you check these out. Naha was walking distance. Sepia 5 minute cab. Lobby bar was very nice with good wine selections. NEGATIVES = As previous guests mentioned = $48/night for parking and I had a weekend/Friday night stay. Seems a tad high. Also a weekend thing, the concierge lounge is closed Friday night to Monday morning. No offer for a free coffee in the Starbucks or restaurant. Overall this is an above average hotel with a high standard and delivers high marks with customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in the heart of town”
Reviews.Author: NashvilleTNGuy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Room 1727 on October 14-17, 2008. Let's start with the good stuff: - Check in is very easy and friendly - The hotel is very pretty and clean - The rooms are big and clean. The new TVs are nice. The safe in the room is a big bonus - Elevators are very quick - Work out room and pool are excellent - Hotel is close to a ton of great stuff. You won't go hungry with donuts, sandwiches, coffee, bars etc very close to the hotel. I suggest the Corner Bakery just down the street. - You are walking distance from the Sears Tower and Millenium Park The only negative: - I was on the backside of the hotel where the train tracks are. The train is very loud late at night and early in the morning. Suggest a room at the front of the hotel or away from the tracks. You will sleep better.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: BearsFanChicago
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance has changed its image from a standard hotel to what they now call an "urban sanctuary" -- and this label could not be more true. The renovations they have made include a fantastic and comprehensive fitness center, stretch room, and pool area. Additionally, their restaurant and lounge are excellent and the rooms are designed with everything that a guest seeking a "sanctuary" would desire. The best part of this hotel, however, remains the staff and the service. Everyone at the Renaissance goes above and beyond and truly has the enjoyment of the guest as the top priority. The only downsides to the Renaissance are that it is difficult to get a cup of coffee before 6 am and they have started spraying this very pungent scent throughout the lobby that caused some problems with my fiancee, who is very sensitive to various odors. Above all, however, the Renaissance is a fantastic hotel that I would recommend wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: kwebsnyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chicago Renaissance for a conference for work. When I walked in I was pleasantly surprised by how nice the lobby was, and check in was a breeze. However, other than those two, my stay was just ok. Nothing wrong, but not great. The room is pretty spacious for being in a city, and the bed was very comfortable.
